description: This Pinot is pretty extracted, but the flavors are addictively good, offering a cornucopia of raspberries, cherries, blackberries, tangerines and cola, with complex nuances of sassafras, orange Pekoe tea, cola and dusty spices. It's a little soft, but silky and rich in tannins, a classic Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir.
title: Roar 2005 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a distinctive Chardonnay, with pea vine and peach, anise and apple mixing it up. It has a lovely, lifted elegance that keeps the flavors intertwined but allows you to experience them separately as well, and it carves a flavor trail through the finish that lingers sensuously. Could be the best CV Chardonnay ever from L'Ecole.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2006 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Packs plenty of powerful complexity into a dry wine that's a pretty good price. Made in full-Burgundian style, with barrel fermentation and lees aging, it's a rich, creamy wine packed with spicy tropical fruit and honeysuckle flavors. Try as an interesting alternative to an upscale Chardonnay.
title: Truchard 2005 Roussanne (Carneros)

description: The fact that this wine comes from the chalkiest of soils and is bone dry gives it considerable austerity. It is definitely mineral in taste and texture, with a touch of salt and grapefruit flavors;  very structured and tight. It needs to age.
title: Agrapart & Fils 2000 Minéral Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: With its highly mineral aroma, this is almost like smelling chalk. It's an austere wine, with high acidity, crystal clear on the palate, full of grapefruit flavors and flint texture. Age this wine at least 4 years.
title: Delamotte NV Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This is one of the biggest, richest Chardonnays that Rodney Strong has ever produced, and no wonder, as longtime winemaker Rick Sayre was assisted by David Ramey as a consultant. The wine has Ramey-esque proportions, gigantic in fleshy tropical fruit, caramel, vanilla cream, butterscotch and meringue flavors. It's so softly decadent, it's almost better as a cocktail wine than with food.
title: Rodney Strong 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Summers has been quietly perfecting Cabernet under the radar. The '04 continues a string of successful vintages. It's riper and more accessible than previous years, and rewards for expressive black currant flavors enhanced with lots of fine, smoky new oak. The tannins are so gentle, you can drink this wine now, but it should hold for a good six years.
title: Summers 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A wonderfully pure, fresh and natural wine, limpid with minerality, green fruits, concentrated pepper and spice. This is a powerful expression of Grüner Veltliner, a rich, but freshly green wine. Glass stopper.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Lindberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: This bubbly charms with cherry and raspberry flavors and a touch of limes and vanilla. It's nice and smooth in the mouth, with a creamy mousse. Showing real finesse and elegance, this sparkler will be delicious with raw tuna.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Soft and finely perfumed, this is full-bodied Riesling, adding just a touch of sweetness to the pear and white currant fruit flavors. This is a great vintage of this wine, probably the best since 2002.
title: Bründlmayer 2006 Langenloiser Steinmassel Riesling (Kamptal)

description: A creamy, smooth wine, flavored with pears, even lychees and full, ripe Grüner Veltliner. This shows the rich side of the grape, while still keeping its essential freshness. Typical pepper flavors come to finish. Glass stopper.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2006 Wachtberg Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Crisp, dry but fruity, this has just enough body to support the red currant flavors and crisp red-apple skin texture. A lively, vibrant wine, all freshness and light, just what a rosé should be.
title: Chanoine NV Tsarine Rosé Brut  (Champagne)

description: Here is yet another Washington Riesling that shows how good these wines can be. This is well beyond the sweet and fruity style of the tasting room wines; here are layers of stone fruits, density and weight, length and detail. Once in the mouth this explodes with flavor and keeps bringing the oranges, peaches, apricots, nectarines and apples to the table.
title: DaMa 2006 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The Awatere is a subregion of Marlborough receiving more and more notice for its distinctive Sauvignons and Pinots. Vavasour was an early pioneer, and the 2007 is especially successful, offering up some slightly sweaty, nettle-y aromas to go along with hints of ripe melons and nectarines. It's nicely concentrated, with a slightly oily mouthfeel and good persistence.
title: Vavasour 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: Mostly Pinot Noir with some Chardonnay, this bubbly shows the pedigree of these two noble varieties in its balance and elegance. It has rich Champagne-like flavors of smoke, brioche, raspberry, lime and vanilla, and finishes dry and polished. This is a great price for a sparkling wine of this quality and sophistication.
title: Mumm Napa NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: A fine follow-up to Seia's inaugural 2004 Clifton Hill, this again delivers ripe, concentrated flavors of plum and berry, lifted with citrus and finishing with a hint of mint. Despite the high (15.3%) alcohol, it is clean and bracing, with natural acids and very little heat in the finish. As young as it is, it hits a bit of a dead spot in the back, but it has the stuffing (and the pedigree) that would suggest that with a few years of cellaring it will open out and show more of the herb and smoked meat character that is lurking just below the surface.
title: Seia 2005 Clifton Hill Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

description: What's so nice about this Cab is its balance and delicacy, without the heaviness that can mar a more alcoholic wine. It shows polished flavors of cherries, blackberries, cola and cedar, with a long, fine finish of cassis liqueur. Really an elegant sipper, this wine is best now and for a couple years.
title: Rocca 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

description: A tiny bottling (220 cases) of old-vine Grenache, this wine features lovely aromas of cinnamon, clove and ripe cherries. In the mouth it's surprisingly elegant, delivering cherry and spice flavors without excessive weight, ending on a slightly tart note. Drink now and over the next 4–5 years.
title: Gibson's BarossaVale 2005 Australian Old Vine Collection Grenache (McLaren Vale)

description: Simple and jammy, with sweet flavors of cherries, currants, licorice and spices.
title: Ca' Momi 2007 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: Sweaty and pruney in the nose, this hot and disjointed wine could be almost any red grape; there's no varietal character. It's volatile and thins out quickly, leaving green tannins in the back of the mouth.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2007 Syrah (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Quite thin, as if over-cropped, turning the fruit generic. Then it brings in a honey character, as if it were botrytis-affected. But it is not a sweet or late harvest wine; it's quite dry.
title: Château Bianca 2008 Wetzel Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Sweet and simple in apricot and pineapple flavors, with a heavy coating of caramelized oak. Drinkable, but disagreeably fruit-juicy.
title: Cobblestone 2008 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A semisweet wine, with apricot jam and citrus flavors, offset by crisp acidity. Turns cloying after a few sips.
title: Francis Coppola 2009 Diamond Collection Emerald Label Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A tough, green wine, with minty sharp acidity and not much fruit, although you'll find some modest cherry flavor.
title: Praxis 2007 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

description: Burning hot in alcohol, this Zin is totally dry. It has peppery flavors of shriveled grapes and currants, with a bitter mouthfeel.
title: Gia Domella 2007 E. Passalacqua Heritage Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: Light and sweet, with raspberry jelly flavors and lots of acidity.
title: Glen Ellen 2009 Zinfandel Rosé (California)

description: Soft and mushy in structure, with sweet, pie-filling flavors of berries that have a baked fruit edge, this Zin tastes like it was a victim of hot overripeness.
title: Hunt Cellars 2004 Destiny Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: A tough, common wine, gritty in tannins, with superripe blackberry flavors that veer into bitter raisinskins and dark, unsweetened baker's chocolate. Not going anywhere.
designation: Long Valley Red Limited Estate Reserve
title: Stuart Cellars 2006 Long Valley Red Limited Estate Reserve Meritage (Temecula Valley)

description: Soft, sweet and Porty, with sugared flavors of red cherry jam and red currants. Feels hot and prickly in the mouth.
title: Venteux 2007 Grenache (Paso Robles)

description: Even though this wine is nicely dry and crisp, it's too vegetal, with a green bean taste.
title: Silvestri 2007 Bella Sandra Chardonnay (Carmel Valley)

description: Not as fleshy as many examples of this southern Rhône blend, this shows thin, generic fruit with no particular focus.
title: Agate Ridge 2008 Marsanne-Roussanne (Rogue Valley)

description: A green, struggling wine from front to back. The nose kicks up underripe aromas to go with distant red fruit, while the palate is edgy and prickly, with high acidity creating snappy cherry and green flavors.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón
title: Bodegas y Vinos de Lécera NV Esenzia Garnacha (Vino de la Tierra del Bajo Aragón)

description: Vegetal, with a green bell pepper aroma and taste. What fruit there is veers toward currants, and the mouthfeel is soft.
title: Carmel 2007 S&S; Syrah (Monterey County)

description: Vegetal, with an asparagus edge to the citrus fruit flavors. That mars this otherwise clean, dry and zesty Chardonnay.
title: Concannon 2008 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Bone dry and tannic, with a sour bite of acidity. It's a pretty fierce Cab, despite some decent blackberry flavors.
title: Mutt Lynch 2007 Chateau d'Og Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: Bone dry and vegetal, with high acidity. Saved, just barely, by some good cherry and oak flavors.
title: Concannon 2008 Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Acidic to the point of sour, with a Lifesaver candy raspberry flavor. At least it's dry.
title: Copeland Creek 2005 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A little too sweet for comfort, with jellied raspberry and cherry flavors edged with the vanilla and caramel tastes from toasted oak barrels. Grows more sugary as it sits in the glass.
title: Dane Cellars 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: It's for you, if you like your Cabs soft, sweet in jellied fruit and hot in alcohol. Tastes like a melted cherry pie, with the sugary, smoky crust.
title: Dane Cellars 2007 Jackknife Corner Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Here's a simple wine that tastes like a supermarket fruit juice blend of peaches, mangoes and apricots. It's soft and one-dimensional and slightly sweet in the finish.
title: Hey Mambo 2008 Chardonnay (California)

description: Restrained both aromatically and on the palate, this Riesling offers modest hints of green apple and pear combined with a slightly herbal note. There's not a lot of complexity or concentration, but it's a brisk, refreshing wine.
title: Hunt Country Vineyards 2009 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pretty harsh and unrewarding, even for this price. It's soft and simple, with Lifesaver raspberry flavors.
title: Smoking Loon 2008 Pinot Noir (California)

description: There's an overripe or jammy element to this Rosso that resembles blackberry preserves, smoked ham and moist tobacco. The wine tastes sweet and sticky in the mouth and leaves the palate covered with strawberry-like flavors.
title: Tenuta Oliveto 2007 Il Roccolo  (Rosso di Montalcino)

description: Super-high in acids, almost sour, and tannic too, with dry flavors of bitter cherries. If this is your kind of wine, break out the rich meats, butter and cheese and enjoy.
title: Villa Andretti 2008 Dolcetto (California)

description: Red-berry, forest floor, crushed herb and tobacco aromas follow over to the fresh medium-bodied palate along with notes of menthol and star anise. Smooth tannins provide polished support. Drink through 2028.
title: Cantina del Nebbiolo 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)

description: Cavallotto didn't make any Barolo in the 2014 vintage due to the cold rainy weather so the firm's best grapes went into this vibrant polished Nebbiolo. It opens with enticing scents of rose, perfumed berry, chopped herb and a whiff of tilled soil that follow through to the racy medium-bodied palate along with crushed raspberry, cherry, star anise and mineral. It's nicely balanced, with firm acidity and taut refined tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Cavallotto 2014 Nebbiolo (Langhe)

description: On the thick, rich and oily side, this is a concentrated, round example of white Hermitage. Subtle toast notes frame pear, melon and peach flavors, then accelerate into caramel notes on the finish. Drink now, or after 2025.
title: Cave de Tain 2015 Grand Classique Marsanne (Hermitage)

description: Ripe and smoky, this is a warm fruity wine. It has tannins as well as juicy acidity, black fruits and a firm structure in the background. This will be a rich wine when it is ready to drink in 2018.
title: Château de Bel 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Full of spice from wood aging and generous fruit, the wine is balanced and poised. It has a style to it, the Merlot perfumed with a touch of Cabernet Franc and made rich with its structure and density. The wine will age, and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Château des Arnauds 2015 Cuvée des Capucins  (Lalande de Pomerol)

description: Made from 40% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 30% Cinsault, this Minervois rosé offers layered, complex scents of orange blossom, peony, ginger and red currant. Flavors of peach and taut currant unfold on the medium-weight palate, with refreshing acidity to lend lift to the mouthfeel and brighten the finish.
title: Château du Donjon 2016 Rosé (Minervois)

description: This 100% Malbec from Hervè Lhuillier's young 2.5-acre parcel is a spicy ripe wine that reflects the warmth of the vintage. Great tannins and bold fruitiness are well blended for a wine that has good potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2015 La Viminière  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: Still with its tannins intact, this is a firm wine with as much dry structure as fruit. It will need time for that structure to soften, giving a wine that will remain firm, which is typical for the vintage. The acidity gives the wine a lift at the end.
title: Château Haut-Cardinal 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a firm wine—one with generous tannins and fruit. It has spice and touches of pepper as well as fine acidity and bold red fruits. The combination has produced a wine that will be ripe and ready to drink from 2019. The property has a history dating back to the 14th century.
title: Château Maison Noble Saint Martin 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The aromas bring spicy notes of cayenne pepper, along with notes of dark-roasted coffee, wood spice and cherry. The palate is full of polished yet voluptuous dark-fruit flavors that are backed by lightly grainy tannins.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Canoe Ridge Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon (58%) and Syrah (34%) make up the majority of this wine, with the balance being pinches of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The aromas bring notes of vanilla, baking spice, graphite and black cherry, with the oak (85% new French) up front. Fruit and barrel play off each other well on the palate. The barrel influence isn't shy but it still brings a lot of enjoyment.
title: Chester Kidder 2013 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Floral and fresh, this light-bodied wine bursts with snappy grapefruit aromas that are followed by bright lemon and raspberry flavors. It's superbly balanced, crisp and appetizing—an elegant version of pink lemonade, without all the sugar.
title: Decoy 2016 Rosé (California)

description: Stainless-steel fermented, this lively white shows lush and plush flavors of melon, pear and peach, making it likably fruit-forward. Amidst the deft ripeness lies more complex accents of wild vanilla and fennel that please and intrigue.
title: Decoy 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Guigal's Côtes du Rhône rosé is a blend of 70% Grenache, 20% Cinsault and 10% Syrah. It's a dark pink shade, rather full bodied and rich. Some earthy, savory notes help balance out the intense cherry-berry fruit, lingering on the finish.
title: E. Guigal 2016 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: This rosé is a field blend of Mourvèdre and Grenache. A very pretty pale-peach color, the aromas bring pleasing notes of herb, spice, strawberry, passion fruit and mineral. The flavors are dry and full in feel, showing weight and intensity but still a sense of lightness.
title: Efeste 2016 Oldfield Estate Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: This small-production, vineyard-designate is impressive in dried cherry and raspberry layers of flavor, supported by integrated oak. Juicy and explosive on the palate, it offers a spicy forest-floor note that complements the fruit.
title: Enkidu 2014 Tina Marie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A blend of 80% Pinot Nero and 20% Chardonnay, this vibrant sparkler offers delicate, appealing aromas of apple, mature pear, toast and bread crust that carry over to the expressive palate along with a note of citrus zest. An elegant continuous perlage accompanies the creamy flavors while a note of toasted hazelnut wraps up the finish.
title: Enrico Serafino 2011 Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)

description: Grapefruit peel, salty miso and white pepper create a savory and appetizing nose. The palate is slender and zippy, full of these spicy notes and enlivened by fresh lemon and green pear. It's a wonderfully easy but exciting Grüner: light but authentic, with lasting pepperiness.
title: Felsner 2016 Moosburgerin Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: This opens with intense aromas of violet, ripe dark-skinned berry and baking spice. The bright, succulent palate shows black cherry, crushed raspberry and black pepper alongside fresh acidity and smooth tannins. Enjoy through 2018.
title: Fontanafredda 2015 Raimonda  (Barbera d'Alba)

description: This wine is nervy, steely, taut and lean, offering earthy, savory aromas, tart cherry and raspberry flavors and a nicely puckering mouthfeel. More minerally than fruity, it provides an interesting example of an alternative wine style.
title: Freeman 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The 2016 rosés from the Southern Rhône provide a glimpse into the superb quality of the vintage. This one boasts notes of crushed stone and lime, then rounds that out with bits of cinnamon or clove and hints of red berries. It's medium in body, with a plump feel and silky texture that lingers through the finish.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 Saint-Vincent Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Made from nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this adds a handful of Petit Verdot for good measure. Smooth, round and approachable, it offers a powerful grip and dense black fruit, finishing with balanced acidity.
title: Gamble Family Vineyards 2013 Paramount Red (Napa Valley)

description: A blend of 90% Pinot Nero and 10% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of citrus zest, ripe orchard fruit, toast and a whiff of acacia flower. The creamy palate offers mature yellow apple, honey and tangerine zest set against bright acidity and a refined perlage.
title: Gancia 2009 Brut Cuvée 60 Mesi Sparkling (Alta Langa)

description: Pear compote is lightly spiced in nutmeg in this full-bodied, creamy white, buzzy in acidity and a stony minerality that presents as tightly woven texture on the palate. Refreshingly balanced, it offers length and breadth as it nears the finish.
title: Geyser Peak 2015 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: A blend of 70% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 10% Mourvèdre, this wine is quite perfumed, with intense aromas of spiced black cherry, forest berry and licorice. The medium-weight palate is plush and mouthfilling, with velvety tannins lending structure to the ripe black-fruit flavors, alongside a touch of graphite. The enduring finish beams with notes of licorice and black pepper.
title: Château du Prieuré des Mourgues 2012 Grande Réserve Red (Saint-Chinian)

description: This blend of Roditis and Viognier starts with aromas of fresh lemon blossom, sea salt and jasmine, leading into a nimble and delicate array of citrus and spice on the palate. Clean and focused but with a curvaceous edge.
title: Mercouri Estate 2015 Foloi Roditis-Viognier White (Peloponnese)

description: Bright and savory, this foaming dessert wine comes with the enticing aromas and flavors of ripe apricot, yellow peach, sage and tangerine. Crisp acidity brightens the rich creamy flavors.
title: Mongioia 2015 Belb  (Moscato d'Asti)

description: Made entirely with the native grape Timorasso, this structured elegant white opens with aromas of acacia flower and hay. The bright palate delivers apricot, lemon zest, hazelnut and a touch of ginger while a mineral vein energizes the finish. Enjoy through 2025.
title: I Carpini 2010 Brezza d'Estate Timorasso (Colli Tortonesi)

description: Pale peach in color, the aromas bring bright notes of passion fruit, guava and strawberry. It drinks dry, but with plenty of kiwi and other tropical-fruit flavors bringing a sense of sweetness. Distinctly fruit forward for a rosé, it delivers a lot of appeal, despite occasionally seeming a bit weighty.
title: The Walls 2016 Cruel Summer Rosé (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: This is the first Chenin Blanc from this up-and-coming winery. All native yeast fermented and aged in stainless steel, the aromas pop, with notes of pear, apple, lees and melon. Sleek in style, it brings a sense of brightness and purity of flavor and bright acids. Very varietally correct, it's a compelling example of Chenin in the state. Pair it with food to see it at its best.
title: W.T. Vintners 2016 Stoneridge Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A Bordeaux-style blend from the iconic Red Mountain site, this is precisely structured with black fruits, zippy acidity and a tight focus. The pinpoint construction suggests that this is cellarable until 2024 at least, and will continue to improve for years before settling into maturity.
title: Soos Creek 2011 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red Red (Red Mountain)

description: Soft, baked aromas of rooty, dark-berry fruits are easier going than the wine's high-toned, acid-driven palate. Flavors of vanilla, coconut, tobacco, prune and spiced berry fruits finish with length and structure along with tobacco and nutmeg accents. Drink through 2020.
title: Aldonia 2007 La Dama  (Rioja)

description: Soothing menthol and green floral notes lend vibe to crisp sour-cherry flavors in this bold, penetrating Bordeaux-style blend. It's rich and brawny on the palate with juicy, primary cherry and plum flavors, yet streaked with delicate touches of oak and earth.
title: Anthony Nappa 2010 Dieci Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: With its attractive aromas and flavors of ripe cherries and subtle notes of pine and dried mint, this wine is immediately accessible without being simple. Likewise, in terms of texture, it's sturdy enough to last a few years, but not so tough as to be off-putting. Complex, flavorful and supple, it should be at its best through at least 2016.
title: Astrolabe 2011 Province Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Pretty aromas of underbrush, crushed blue flower and perfumed berries lead the nose on this robust Rosso. The dense palate delivers succulent black cherry, raspberry, mocha and sweet cake spices alongside firm tannins. It's not an ager so enjoy soon.
title: Baricci 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: A strong, vibrant texture of crisp acidity and firm tannins energizes this flavorful and distinctive wine. Red cherry and raspberry aromas lead to crisp cranberry and cherry flavors. An appealing dry finish brings you back for another sip.
title: Bogle 2012 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Intensely juicy, this wine delivers tannins as well as red berry fruit flavors. Great acidity brings out a fresh side. The structure will push the wine forward and give it a good future. Drink from 2017.
title: Yohan Lardy 2013 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: An immediately approachable wine with aromas of smoke, crushed stone and dark plum, this is a soft, supple example of its appellation. A bit of caramel emerges on the finish, where it coexists with mixed berry fruit.
title: Lavau 2010 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Made from 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this hearty wine features earthy aromas of underbrush, tilled soil and mature black fruits. The juicy palate delivers fleshy black cherry, plum, nutmeg, espresso, black pepper and licorice alongside a solid tannic backbone. Drink through 2019.
title: Vèscine 2009  Chianti Classico

description: Dusty mineral and smoke tones add complexity to fresh lemon and lime aromas on this concentrated, powerful off-dry Riesling. It's lush and silky on the palate, with ripe pineapple and yellow peach flavors. Lime juice acidity jolts the finish.
title: Wagner 2012 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Showy and rich, it features lots of tasty oak influence and ripe, generous fruit flavors, but it doesn't go over the top. This is full-bodied, broad in texture and not too tannic. Made from mature, hillside vines, it's especially impressive in this challenging vintage.
title: Wildhurst 2011 Home Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)

description: Windy Oaks' 2012s are lighter in color than their vintage compatriots, yet not lacking in aromas, which include sage, tomato, black olive and curry. The leaner palate begins a bit light before emerging with olive tapenade and crushed herbs. It would pair well with a burger, roasted chicken, or gourmet burrito.
title: Windy Oaks 2012 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Properly structured, this is a solid wine. Great swathes of plum fruits are partnered with firm tannins. It is dark and firm, with a dense character. Touches of chocolate and roasted coffee go with the rich plums. Drink from 2015.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Morgon

description: Lightly off dry, this graceful and beautifully balanced wine blends in about 7% Gewürztraminer, elevating the aromatics. Key lime, pink grapefruit and a touch of lemon zest are in play, with a finish that recalls a sip of English breakfast tea.
title: Hogue 2013 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This has fresh oak and ripe boysenberry aromas and flavors. A thick but not harsh texure wraps around the tongue and keeps the flavors lingering on the finish. It's appropriately tannic and appetizingly dry, needing rich food or a drinker who loves this kind of delicious density.
title: Jamieson Ranch 2011 Whiplash Red (California)

description: Made from a blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot, this ripe wine delivers soft plum, black currants, clove and cracked pepper sensations accented with coffee and espresso notes. A backbone of firm tannins give structure. Drink now through 2019.
title: Castello San Donato in Perano 2009 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: This serious wine is still very young. Its black fruits and firm tannins are showing considerable potential, with acidity and a firm core still developing. This will be a powerful wine and one that needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Pizay 2013  Morgon

description: Smooth and spicy, this is a soft style of Malbec. It has tannins, to be sure, but they are suavely integrated into the berry fruits, the touch of mint and the spice from wood aging. The aftertaste brings out refreshing layers of juicy acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Famaey 2011 Malbec (Cahors)

description: Six grapes led by Cabernet Sauvignon have been blended into Lazuli, which starts out spicy and herbal. The palate is lively and juicy, with good overall feel. Peppery notes accent roasted berry flavors, while the finish delivers a strong spine and salty, herbal notes that are complex.
title: Chilensis 2010 Lazuli Red (Maule Valley)

description: From the Loire Valley's Bourgeois family, this is a firmly built wine from a region known more for its open-knit accessibility. Sturdy beet and black cherry notes seem destined to last, framed by firm tannins. Drink 2015–2020.
title: Clos Henri 2011 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Aromas of meat juices, forest floor, perfumed berries and grilled herbs lead the nose on this savory, full-bodied Rosso. The dense palate doles out ripe wild cherry accented with orange peel and allspice. Bold, velvety, and fresh, it's made to be enjoyed soon.
title: Collosorbo 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Complexity on the nose comes via earthy aromas of licorice root, sandalwood and mild berry fruits. The palate is on the big and bullish side, but it's neither heavy nor fierce. Flavors of ripe blackberry, pepper and chocolate finish with a touch of herbs and mint. Drink through 2017.
title: Concha y Toro 2011 Marques de Casa Concha Syrah (Buin)

description: This structured Nebbiolo delivers classic sensations of dark cherry, clove, cinnamon and a hint of orange peel. Vibrant, with fresh acidity balanced by silky-smooth tannins, it's ready to be enjoyed now.
title: Damilano 2012 Marghe Nebbiolo (Langhe)

description: This is a smooth, ripe and rounded wine with solid tannins and rich plum and berry fruits. From a good vintage, it is full of tannins, smoky wood and balanced acidity. It's a full, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Domaine d'Arton 2010 La Croix d'Arton Réserve Red (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This rich and full-bodied wine has spice, black fruits and smoky tannins all bundled together into a ripe structure. It's a complex, concentrated wine with finishing acidity that needs to age, so drink from 2015.
title: Domaine Dubost 2013 Cuvée Monthieux  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This muscular blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre spends about a year in oak prior to bottling, yet the oak has integrated well, adding notes of clove and cinnamon. Cracked pepper, plums and black olives round out the flavor profile, and dusty tannins linger on the finish. Drink 2016–2025.
title: Domaine Maby 2012 Nessun Dorma Red (Lirac)

description: Blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this has pinpoint focus and is packed with ripe berry fruit. The oak aging (45% new) and crisp tannins layer in veins of espresso and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2022.
title: Dusted Valley 2011 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Heady aromatics create a signature on this wine, so floral in lychee, orange blossom and lemongrass. Light and dry, it's classically varietal, with grapefruit and tangerine jockeying for attention amidst plenty of minerality.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2013 Dutton Ranch Green Valley Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Green Valley)

description: Popcorn and white-fruit aromas are toasty, nutty and appropriate. This is zesty and well-cut across the palate. Flavors of apple, peach, papaya and buttered movie popcorn finish oaky, briny and elegant, with a chiseled, acid-driven feel.
title: Errazuriz 2013 Aconcagua Costa Chardonnay (Aconcagua Valley)

description: A mix of fruit spanning across the Russian River Valley, this complex Chardonnay is so inviting and approachable. Brimming in ripe Gravenstein apple and baking spices, it conveys alluring and lush crispness as well as balanced fruit and floral aromas.
title: Gary Farrell 2012 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The grapes come from a small family estate in the heart of Bourgueil. Light and mineral-textured, this wine offers layers of spice and violet aromas. The characteristic cool-climate stalkiness is present, well balanced with the firm tannins and acidity. It will be better with more aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Cave de Bourgueil 2014 Domaine de Chanteloup Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

description: The name of the wine says a lot about its structure. It definitely has a mineral tang to it although the ripe yellow fruits do give it a soft cushion. The acidity however makes it crisp, refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2015 Minéral  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: Earthy aromas of truffle, game and moist earth mingle with overripe plum and a confectionery note. The palate is evolved, offering leather, raisin and tobacco alongside loosely knit, rather fleeting tannins.
title: Corteforte 2010 Terre di San Zeno  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: The wine has tannins and a dry core that is fleshed out with red-berry fruits. At three-years-old it is already maturing with a rustic edge as well as spice and berry fruits. This is ready to drink.
designation: Clos de Grands Voyens Premier Cru
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2013 Clos de Grands Voyens Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: The fragrance of black cherries and violet lay the groundwork for flavors of cherry, Fuji apple, eucalyptus, violet and a touch of iodine. Although labeled medium-dry, this blend of two grapes native to Georgia—one red, one white—is truly on the dry side. It is very soft in the mouth, with a nice touch of menthol on the finish.
title: Tbilvino 2015 Sachino Red (Kakheti)

description: Montagny is at the southern end of the Côte Chalonnaise before it merges into Mâcon. That gives this wine its warmth and ripe apple and peach fruits. It is crisp and fresh at the same time with great juicy acidity. The wine has a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: Aromas of truffle, tilled soil, dark berry and a whiff of blue flower lead the nose on this easygoing red. The lithe palate delivers dark cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside supple tannins and bright acidity.
title: Villa I Cipressi 2014  Rosso di Montalcino

description: Merlot makes up 45% of this wine, with the rest Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Sangiovese, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Zinfandel, and Tempranillo. Aromas of green herb, plum, freshly hewn wood and coffee are followed by smooth-drinking fruit and barrel flavors, with the tannins showing a touch of astringency.
title: Waterbrook 2014 Mélange Founder's Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Comenge, which is headquartered in nearby Ribera del Duero, has branched out into Rueda with this lean, clean Verdejo that opens with citrus aromas and a tight mouthfeel. Stony tangerine and lemony flavors turn salty and briny on a light finish.
title: Comenge 2015 Familia Comenge Verdejo (Rueda)

description: Blackberry aromas along with minerally vitamin notes open this fresh lean angular Cabernet from western Colchagua. Choppy currant and plum flavors are dry and spicy, while this finishes with herbal red-fruit flavors, spice and chocolate notes.
designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca
title: Concha y Toro 2014 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca Cabernet Sauvignon (Marchigue)

description: Dusty citrus aromas show a hint of butterscotch. This feels about right, with modest lift coming from mild acidity. Dry simple flavors of white pepper and generic bitterness close this out.
title: Cruzat NV Extra Brut Cuvée Réserve Sparkling (Valle de Uco)

description: Aromas of stewed prune, tobacco, resin and menthol lead the noses. The full-bodied, one-dimensional palate is rather evolved, offering raisin and clove alongside close-grained but not very persistent tannins.
title: Delibori 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Made from certified organic grapes, this is a medium-bodied blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Merlot. Bay leaf and black olive aromas add earthy notes on the palate, giving this ripe, chocolaty wine an anchor in the south of France. Drink now.
title: Famille Perrin 2014 L'Oustalet Red (Vin de France)

description: Fragrant blue flower, tilled soil and wild berry aromas lead the nose. The light-bodied, accessible palate offers tart cherry and a hint of chopped herb. It's fresh and easy drinking, with loose-knit tannins.
title: Baccinetti 2014 Saporoia  (Rosso di Montalcino)

description: The 2012 Taste Red shares many of the spicy, chocolate and graham cracker undertones of the 2013 vintage, but it's a bit more forward and plump with black-fruit flavors. Round and rich in texture yet refreshingly light in body, it's an easygoing red blend with wide appeal. Drink now through 2021.
title: Bedell 2012 Taste Red (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Fruity like grape jam and blackberry syrup, this is a rich, almost-sweet wine. It has a very dark color, impressive fruit concentration and a smooth texture.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Dark Red (California)

description: Pear and melon aromas are mild but clean. This is slightly crisp and tangy, with good grip. Lightly brined citrus flavors finish steady. Overall this qualifies as a nice everyday white.
title: Bodegas Muriel 2015 Vendimia Seleccionada Viura (Rioja)

description: Minty oak aromas are the greeting on this herbal and foxy Malbec that feels crisp and chippy due to high acidity and grating tannins. Flavors of herbal berry and plum are oaky and a touch hot, while rubbery tannins and herbal berry leftovers drive the finish.
title: Casarena 2014 Estate Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

description: Bursts of tropical citrus, mango and melon abound from nose to finish in this forward,fruity off-dry Riesling. Its uncomplicated fruitiness is a bit reminiscent of mixed-fruit cocktail, but it's juicy and approachable for a wide audience. Drink now through 2018.
title: Heron Hill 2014 Ingle Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: A whiff of charred wood and pencil lead adds a little complexity to this otherwise straightforward, fruity and rather soft-textured wine. It is medium bodied, and the cherry and berry flavors seem to sweeten on the finish.
title: Hey Mambo 2014 Sultry Red (California)

description: Intensely ripe and ruddy black cherry and berry flavors seem spiced with cocoa powder and cinnamon in this approachable juicy wine. Bright acidity lends freshness to the midpalate. The finish is cushioned by soft feathery tannins and lingering hints of sweet spice.
title: Jamesport 2013 Estate Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Violet, red berry and baking spice aromas take center stage on this zesty red. The tart palate offers cranberry, sour cherry and star anise alongside racy zesty acidity and rather grainy tannins that leave a mouth-puckering finish.
title: La Fornace 2014  Rosso di Montalcino

description: A nearly dry version of Moscato, this wine drinks more like a table wine. It has good, full body, fairly deep pear and pistachio flavors, and a rich texture.
title: LangeTwins 2015 Estate Grown Moscato (Clarksburg)

description: Aromas of plum, scorched earth and a whiff of game lead the nose. The palate offers dried black cherry, leather, anise and sage alongside firm but fleeting tannins that lead to a somewhat abrupt, astringent close.
title: Le Vigne 2010 Fontecuoia Riserva  (Montecucco)

description: Bold and spicy, this dry wine is saturated with toasty oak and vanilla flavors over plum and prune. Made from mostly Petite Sirah and Syrah, it has medium body and a smooth texture.
title: Leese-Fitch 2014 Firehouse Red (California)

description: Flavorful and smooth in texture, this wine smells almost floral, with fruity and spicy notes like cloves. Full of ripe plum and raisin flavors, it has full body and a broad, soft feeling in the mouth.
title: Leese-Fitch 2014 Zinfandel (California)

description: Aromas of red apple and spice lead to rounded fruit flavors that provide easy-drinking appeal. It's a well-priced spot-on example of the variety.
title: Lone Birch 2015 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: This wine is 100% Sangiovese and is a pale pink color. Aromas of cherry bubblegum and herb lead to a dry full-feeling palate. The alcohol pokes out a bit at times but it still provides enjoyment.
title: Airfield Estates 2015 Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: For a wine from this appellation, this is surprisingly soft. It has black fruits and tannins that are already softening. Spice and berry fruits are lifted by acidity. This fruity wine will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Intensely ripe cherry and berry flavors mark this plush, softly structured rosé. It's easygoing, fruity style is approachable.
title: Sannino 2014 Bianca Rosé Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: There's a pruney, dried-fruit persistence on the nose of this wine, a blend of unknown varieties. Barbecue smoke, black pepper and a high degree of ripeness combine for a mix of heat that's finalized by a vegetative note.
title: Together 2013 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

description: This is a fresh and crisp wine with touches of sweetness. Red fruits are combined with ripe apple and acidity to give a lively fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Sauvion 2015  Rosé d'Anjou

description: While initially quite smoky and nutty on the nose, this light-bodied wine does release prettier notes of cherry and raspberry with some aeration. Soft acidity lends heaviness to the plate. The finish is brisk and clean.
title: The Old Field 2014 Cacklin' Rosé Dry Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Baked cinnamon and cherry tart form a promising beginning into this wine, but an intrusive addition of root beer pushes it over the edge in terms of cloying flavor. The wine then becomes somewhat flimsy on the palate.
title: Pali 2013 Riviera Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The wine suffers from heavy extraction that has left wood rather than fruit. Somewhere in there, the black-currant fruit and acidity are struggling. It will soften, although that wood will remain a problem.
title: Château Pipeau 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: Light pink in color, this is a pretty wine made from 100% Grolleau. It is soft, medium sweet with integrated acidity that comes from the fresh raspberries. It is ready to drink.
title: Bougrier 2015  Rosé d'Anjou

description: There's a dullness to this wine, which flirts with the idea of plum and cherry flavor yet gets somewhat bogged down in marshmallow. Light bodied, it presents with more ripe sweetness than it may actually have.
title: Cannonball 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Black currants and spice give this wine its main aromatic character. On the palate, it's light with a dry core that is still dominant. The wine is more about structure and will probably stay that way.
title: Château Haut Laulion 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: A wood-flavored wine that shows high toast and a burnt character. It has acidity and some fruit tannins although the fruit itself is missing. The result is a wine that will end up austere and with too much wood flavor.
title: Château Julian 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: The wine has an orange-pink color and a palate packed with red fruits. It is lightly tannic and with a strawberry aftertaste.
title: Château Maison Noble 2015 Red (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: This red-currant and red-berry flavored wine is bright and fruity. It does have some wood-aging flavors that add spice and a dry edge. The juicy acidity at the end keeps it all fresh.
title: Château Joinin 2014  Bordeaux

description: Bright gold in color, with oily aromas of dried apricot, this is distinctly not peppy or lively on the nose. Mature and fleshy in feel, this is on its last legs. Flavors of bitter stone fruits and salt hold steady on the finish.
title: Attis 2014 Lías Finas Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: This is a fresh, lemon-scented wine. It is light both in texture and in the fruity department with just a bright citrus character finished with acidity. The wine is ready now.
title: Les Vignerons du Pallet 2014 La Marinière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)

description: This wine is calm and cool. It tastes very smooth in texture and has soothing, simple fruit flavors and medium body.
title: Girasole 2015 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

description: Slightly sour red plum, red cherry, tar and dust show on the nose of this simple wine. More tar and rubber flavors arise on the palate, where light red fruit also emerges.
title: Midnight 2012 Full Moon Red (Paso Robles)

description: Citrus and apricot aromas are basic. This feels dilute but fresh. Peppery, slightly bitter and stalky white-fruit flavors finish similarly.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Mureda 2015 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: The wine is ripe and fat. It has apple and pear flavors along with a smooth texture. Mouth-filling and dense, the wine seems heavy.
designation: Clos de la Clemencière Sur Lie
title: Vignoble Malidain 2015 Clos de la Clemencière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)

description: Aromas of dish soap and kitchen cleanser don't stink but they aren't impressive, either. Round on the palate, with low acidity, this tastes of chunky, mealy apple and finishes tired and briny.
title: Despierta 2014 Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: Barrel-fermented in entirely new Russian oak, not something one sees every day, this somewhat thin, while ripe, wine offers a curious combination of anise and ham.
title: Trinitas 2012 Family Collection Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: This wine comes off as quite green especially considering the variety, vintage and appellation. Aromas of bell pepper and green herbs lead to cherry and savory flavors, with the tannins bringing some heft.
title: Latah Creek 2012 Fries Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

description: Aromas of fresh asparagus, grass and tropical fruit are followed by dry, light-bodied, easy-drinking fruit flavors. This wine doesn't offer a lot of complexity but still brings appeal.
title: Original House Wine NV Sauvignon Blanc (America)

description: Aromas of mesquite, smoke, strawberry, freesia and herbs are followed by quite light fruit flavors. The concentration seems wanting.
title: Bethany Vineyard 2011 Estate Produced Pinot Noir (Washington)

description: Candied aromas lead to a bland, confected wine that is flat and missing fruit. It is clean with a hint of perfumed lime. There is little of interest here.
title: Vignobles Grandeau 2015 Château Lauduc Classic Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Oily aromas of citrus rind and nettle come in front of a juicy palate. From that point on this Chardonnay struggles. Weedy, peppery, pyrazinic flavors finish bitter. As a whole, this Chardonnay gets a passing grade but barely.
title: Bodega Otto Bestué 2015 Bestué de Otto Bestué Chardonnay (Somontano)

description: The wine is very soft, probably too much so. With a smooth texture, it lacks definition or great fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Lamothe Barrau 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The aromas of apple and pear are light, seeming to show some lees influence. Flavors are dry and straight down the fairway on this innocuous easy drinker.
title: Original House Wine NV Pinot Grigio (America)

description: This is a lightly sweet wine with candy flavors and an attractive touch of acidity and an orange zest backdrop. It's ready to drink now either as an apéritif or with spicy food.
title: Marquis de Goulaine 2015 La Roseraie  (Rosé d'Anjou)

description: Dense olallieberry and asphalt show on the nose of this bottling, as does a tart black-plum-skin scent. There is grape-like sweetness to the palate, and touches of cola, but not much else.
title: Graveyard NV Paso Tombstone Red (Paso Robles)

description: This opens with funky aromas of game, cured meat and wet animal fur. Rustic and lean, the astringent palate offers a suggestion of powdered sage and a balsamic note but lacks fruit.
title: Tenuta L'Illuminata 2012 Tebavio  (Barolo)

description: A traditional blend of Chardonnay (72%) and Pinot Nero, this luminous sparkling wine offers yeasty tones of fresh bread, mature apricot and caramel. It has good density and length and is perfect for the festive holiday season.
title: Bellavista 2004 Gran Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Here's a sophisticated sparkler (made with 80% Chardonnay and a remaining component of Pinot Nero and Pinot Bianco) that opens with creamy notes of apricot, honey and toasted baguette. Tangy apricot flavors are backed by tart lemon zest flavors and lively bubbling.
title: Bellavista NV Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Elegant and clean, this Brut Satèn sparkler boasts a feminine side thanks to its soft perlage and delicate aromas of peach blossom and honeysuckle. It's an attractive and fresh wine that remains compact and composed to the finish.
title: Bellavista NV Gran Cuvée Satèn Brut Chardonnay (Franciacorta)

description: Chardonnay, Pinot Nero and Pinot Bianco make up this peach-colored rosé sparkler. Aromas include creamy yeast, rose petal, pink grapefruit and lemon zest. The wine is fresh, firm and offers tart apple flavors on the close.
title: Berlucchi NV Cuvèe Imperiale Max Rosé Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Shea shows some muscle here, yet remains fruit-driven, with a lush midpalate mixing strawberry and raspberry fruit with cola/sassafras soda flavors. In keeping with Boedecker's style, this wine is extremely clean, the fruit is fresh and the flavors nicely detailed. Nothing big or over the top here, but first-class winemaking.
title: Boedecker Cellars 2006 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Extraordinarily rich in briary flavors of wild blackberries, licorice, cocoa and pepper, this Syrah has the added virtue of finishing dry. Although it's a bit soft, it's a beauty, especially at this price.
title: Bonterra 2006 Syrah (Mendocino County)

description: Sweet floral notes open the way for soft flavors of peach, apricot cream and honey. This Prosecco sparkler offers foamy, creamy peach flavors backed by well-balanced levels of sweetness and acidity and impressive complexity. This is one of the best Proseccos on the market today.
title: Bortolomiol 2008 Cartizze Dry  (Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze)

description: Lush describes this Syrah. With a little bottle age, it's achieved a nice, creamy softness, and offers mouthwatering flavors of chocolate-covered cherries, ripe crushed blackberries and pepper. There's also a lot of oak, adding intricacies of caramel and sweet woodspice.
title: Carr 2005 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Pure citrus aromas give this wine an immediate and attractive lift. It is supremely fresh, light and airy, its freshness highlighted by the lightly toasty wood. The texture gives more density, showing rich apple skins and pear spice, followed by a finish that again shows great acidity.
title: Château Brown 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: Spicy new wood is obvious in the aroma of this smooth, polished, ripe white wine. It has richness, with its flavors of nutmeg, pears and fresh red apple acidity. The wine is worth aging for two years, to allow the fruit and wood to blend.
title: Château la Garde 2007  Pessac-Léognan

description: The alcohol is pretty high, but the wine is decadently rich and forward in pie-filling flavors of cherries, raspberries, currants and chocolate, seasoned with anise, cinnamon and pepper. Firm tannins give much-needed structure to this deliciously dry Cab Franc.
title: Viansa 2005 Samuele Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)

description: This small-production blend of Carmenère, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah is deep, layered and exciting. The nose is creamy but diligent, with plum, cassis, chocolate and a touch of popcorn coming from the oak. The palate is smooth and healthy, with cassis, cherry, plum, tobacco and herb flavors in front of a bright, alert, cola-driven finish. Really good for a Chilean blend. 500 cases produced.
title: Viña Santa Cruz 2006 Tupu Edicion Limitada Red (Colchagua Valley)

description: Strikes a nice balance of ripe berry and chocolate flavors, firmed with softly smooth tannins, and a deep earthy-spiciness suggesting sweet tobacco, anise and sage. Turns lush and intricate toward the finish. This is a really nice Zinfandel.
title: Hobo 2007 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This vibrant metodo classico Brut sparkling wine from Piedmont delivers rich tones of peach, sun-dried apricot and toasted bread. It has tonic, persistent perlage and offers a creamy, sophisticated feel in the mouth.
title: La Scolca 2004 Soldati Brut Sparkling (Piedmont)

description: You finish a bottle of Champagne, and with the last glass the wine suddenly opens out. This Grand Cru Brut is just that style of Champagne. It is closed, tight and needs time to breathe. That's partly because the yeastiness gives it a young character, but also because the steely, citrus character needs the opportunity to broaden. Then it becomes a fine wine.
title: Lamiable NV Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: Here's a nice, dry and fairly complex Pinot Noir that makes you think of grilled steaks or roast lamb. It's silky in the mouth, and offers flavors of mashed red cherries, Dr. Pepper, rhubarbs and spices, enhanced with smoky cedar. Best now through 2012.
title: Mahoney 2006 Las Brisas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The Wess style is for rounded wines, with a ripe, creamy texture. While this Terrassen is all about fresh fruit, it also has the same extra richness in its makeup. The floral character of Riesling is evident, as are flavors of white peaches and dried apricots. There's even a touch of pepper for the spice. Screwcap.
title: Rainer Wess 2007 Terrassen Riesling (Wachau)

description: Firm and full in the mouth, Cabochon is a layered wine with deep folds of stone fruit, piecrust and honey. It offers a creamy consistency and lively perlage, enhanced by piquant spice on the close.
title: Monte Rossa 2003 Cabochon Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Extremely delicate and soft in terms of its aromatic intensity, this Prosecco Brut offers a graceful and precise embroidery of foamy, light peach fruit and spring flowers. Yet the sparkler is quite effective in the mouth thanks to its refreshing acidity and perky bubbling.
title: Nino Franco 2007 Rive di San Floriano Brut  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: This full-bodied, well structured Pinot Noir offers some minty, herbal notes and hints of cedar alongside tart plum and cherry flavors. Crisp acids and firm tannins frame the tightly wrapped flavors, which should unfold over the next 8 or 9 years.
title: Northfield 2007 Home Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Waipara)

description: Very soft, creamy in the 1999 vintage style, open and warm. The Chardonnay shows richness, ripeness, with white and yellow fruit flavors, apricots and baked apples, and only the lightest hint of minerality.
designation: Le Mesnil sur Oger Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pascal Doquet 1999 Le Mesnil sur Oger Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This nicely balanced Barossa Shiraz shows that not all Barossa wines are overweight. Sure, it has the soft, lush tannins and textures of its region, but there's also attractive herbal and savory overtones to the berry fruit.
title: Peter Lehmann 2006 Shiraz (Barossa)

description: Like many top Marlborough Sauvignons, this wine has a leafy, herbal component backed by copious fruit. In this case, the wine delivers touches of nectarine and pineapple, along with a bit of chili pepper. It's medium-bodied, with a long, mouth-watering finish.
title: Sauvignon Republic 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: You'll find tons of blackberry, cherry, raspberry, orange zest, chocolate and spice flavors in this dry wine, but it's no mere fruit store. With polished tannins and fine Carneros acidity, it achieves an elegant balance. Drink now.
title: Schug 2005 Heritage Reserve Merlot (Carneros)

description: This is a finely made wine, bringing out really concentrated herbaceous flavors, almost New Zealand in their intensity. It is fresh, green, grassy, ready to drink now.
title: Château Reynon 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Any vintage Champagne from 2004 will still be young, and this is no exception. But with the fresh, light Deutz style, this is already offering delicious green plum and citrus flavors, supplemented by creamy acidity. The finish is soft, light, creamy.
title: Deutz 2004 Brut  (Champagne)

description: This new producer is off to a good start with its first vintage. The fruit is clean and complex, ranging from watermelon to wild strawberry to pie cherry as it washes across the palate. Deep in color, yet light in the mouth, this not only makes you reach for a second glass, it makes you wish the vineyard, planted in 2001, would hurry up and age.
title: Eastburn Vineyards 2006 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Powdered sugar and other lightly confected aromas set up more steely apple and pineapple flavors. Finishes pithy, with grapefruit. Drying and short, but still a reasonable facsimile of Champagne.
title: Viña La Rosa NV Brut Chardonnay (Cachapoal Valley)

description: We haven't seen much improvement in this wine since the 2003 vintage. It's still lacking forward, ripe fruit and instead shows more leather and drying, firm tannins. Shows glimpses of higher quality but can't support them.
title: Mayu 2004 Malbec (San Juan)

description: Minerally and a touch earthy on the nose, this follows with toast and sweet fruit on the palate, which is both simple and friendly. Overall, the wine has an array of good, clean flavors and a zippy finish.
title: Cricova 2001 Collection Semidry  (Moldova)

description: Heavy-handed Champagne, and rather overblown. The fruit has flavors of ripe apples, with strong hints of sweetness from the dosage.
title: Charles Lafitte 1989 Orgueil de France Brut  (Champagne)

description: Lots of people will like this sweet young Lodi Zin for its jammy raspberry, cherry and cola flavors, and its tannins will cut through a sugary barbecue sauce. But if you're looking for something dry, go elsewhere.
title: Cosentino 2005 Crystal Valley Cellars The Zin Zinfandel (California)

description: Concentrated and intense, but typical of Bonarda this is a fierce wine with a rock-hard mouthfeel and slightly tart, limited raspberry flavors. Not exactly sour but it makes your mouth seize up and take notice.
title: Sur de los Andes 2006 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: A very pretty, opulent floral nose with hints of spice lead on this Hungarian sparkler. On the palate, it has a clean, minerally flavor that lacks some of the dimension and finesse that the nose would lead one to expect. A good food wine, though—and fun. Imported by MHW Ltd.
title: Törley NV Gála Sparkling (Hungary)

description: Burnt popcorn and some ammonia make the nose fairly harsh. Time softens it a bit as it yields to green-fruit flavors. Finishes dry as a soda cracker, with some Old World touches. Not an easy wine to enjoy; it's very lean and underdeveloped.
title: Pascual Toso NV Toso Brut Sparkling (Mendoza)

description: Slightly stewed fruit scents suggest cooked prunes, and lead into a pretty hard, tannic red wine. It has leafy, somewhat underripe flavors, lots of tannin and a generic red wine flavor; it could be almost anything.
title: Powers 2004 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Soft, flat and simple, this Chard tastes like tangerine-flavored cola soda, with some oaky substance added for vanilla.
title: Silverado 2006 Chardonnay (Napa County)

description: Not much going on in this flat, candy-sweet wine. It tastes like the liquid in canned peaches and pineapples.
title: Silverado 2006 Miller Ranch Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: There is something a little funky about this wine. At first, it has a creamy quality that mixes well with the peach and apricot flavors and gives the wine a certain complexity, but over time, that edge becomes a little dank, and begins to overwhelm the fruit.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2005 Nivole  (Moscato d'Asti)

description: Thin and raw, and slightly sweet, this is not a very satisfying Cab. It tastes like candied blackberry and cherry LifeSavers.
title: Conn Creek 2004 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Hard and tannic, this doesn't show much in the way of varietal character. There's a hint of red fruit, some tar and rubber, and a thin, somewhat stemmy finish.
title: Covington 2005 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Herbal aromas infiltrate the nose, and the palate features midlevel red fruit with a strong herbal edge. The finish shows saline, chocolate and pepper, and never does it rise much above struggling.
title: Alfredo Roca 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon

description: Simple and rough in texture, with medicinal citrus fruit and dough flavors.
title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Premium Extra Dry Chardonnay Champagne Sparkling (California)

description: Soft, simple and semisweet, this Tempranillo has cherry, raspberry and spice flavors. It can be described as rustic.
title: Barreto 2004 Tempranillo (Lodi)

description: Broad in the mouth and on the sweet side, this Chardonnay-Pinot Noir blend does offer some attractive gingery notes on the nose, while the flavors favor baked apples.
title: Silverwing NV Brut  (Australia)

description: Very stiff and tannic, with hard, stemmy flavors and very little evidence of ripe fruit.
title: Hoodsport 2005 Cabernet Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Scoury and sweet in the mouth, this blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay has forward flavors of peaches, limes, oranges, honey and vanilla. With brisk acidity, it's a nice bubbly to drink now.
title: Korbel 2010 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Like the label says, this Pinot Noir-based blend of multiple varieties is sugary sweet, with raspberry, vanilla and toast flavors. It's a refreshing and easy to drink.
title: Korbel NV Sweet Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: This Pinot is dry, silky and light-bodied. It shows pleasant raspberry, cola and red currant flavors that finish clean and racy, and the alcohol level is a refreshingly low 13.5% by volume. It requires no aging, so drink up.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2011 Goodchild High 9 Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Aged in neutral French oak, it has light notes of herbs, plum, pencil lead and crushed flowers. The acids are tart and racy competing with somewhat gruff tannins. Pair it with pizza or pasta with a red sauce to see it at its best.
title: Abacela 2010 Estate Grown Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

description: While on the light side, this is an attractive, fruity wine. It has a creamy, soft feel to it with fresh pear flavors, as well as a touch of vanilla from the gentle wood aging. It's ready to drink now, but will be better in a year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Soft and warm, this wine originates from the northern end of the Côte de Nuits. It has wild-raspberry and dark cherry flavors balanced with elegant acidity. It's wine that will age quickly, so drink from 2014.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature La Mazière  (Fixin)

description: A dark, ripe and fruity wine that is full of dense red-fruit aromas and spicy tannins. The palate offers ample freshness, with crisp, juicy red berry fruit up front. Drink now and until 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A cool, crisp and fresh wine that also has enough weight to go well with food. It has lively lemon, plum and red apple flavors. A touch of steely character lends great shape to this ready to drink wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal White (Tejo)

description: There's a whiff of almond, a flavor of lime pith and a finish of wet stone in this light Pinot Blanc. A suggestion of cracker comes through in the finish.
title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2012 Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

description: A soft, smooth and juicy wine, with attractive red fruit aromas and a warm, fragrant texture. The wine has spice, hints of herbs and a strong layer of acidity. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2010 Bridão Clássico Red (Tejo)

description: This sparkling wine has aromas of baked apricot, walnut, hay, citrus and oak. The palate is lean and dry, without enough fruit richness to support the oak.
title: Castello Bonomi 2007 Dosage Zero Millesimato Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This is a bright and fruity red-currant and berry-fruited wine. It has some richness along with a more stalky edge. Wood aging shows subtly along with the firm tannins of the vintage. Drink from 2014.
title: Château la Rose Belair 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: It's not clear what the varietal blend is, but it tastes like a Rhône-style wine, and a simple one, at that. Soft and silky, it has raspberry, honey, toasted almond and cinnamon flavors.
title: Demetria 2010 Pantheon Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A hint of earthiness and tannins add complexity to this fruity, bright wine full of red berry flavors. It's fragrant, delicious and refreshingly juicy, but not for aging.
title: Domaine les Cantates 2011 Mondeuse (Chignin)

description: A delightful Pinot Grigio, perfect for drinking as an appetizer wine, or with anything from fried chicken to Vietnamese pho. It's crisp in acidity, which gives a balanced structure to the ripe lime, apple and peach fruit flavors.
title: Domino 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Here's a simple but well made red from Tuscany that has floral aromas of violet and rose with berry notes. The palate offers bright cherry, red currant and a touch of spice. Pair this with pasta dishes or grilled vegetables.
title: Fattoria di Grignano 2011 Pietramaggio Red (Toscana)

description: This is a smooth, creamy wine, with apple and pear aromas and flavors, as well as a crisp texture. It's full-bodied, very fruity and ready to drink, with bursting freshness and lingering acidity.
title: Quevedo 2012 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a perfumed wine, its freshness leaping from the glass. It has crisp green and white fruits, lively acidity and a light, tangy character. The finish shows more richness and a dry, textured feel.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 White (Tejo)

description: Here's a simple Barbera with bright aromas of red fruit. On the palate, this shows cherry along with a hint of vanilla and peppery notes. Very fresh and smooth, but ready to drink now.
title: Villadoria 2012 Tardoc  (Barbera d'Alba)

description: Kenwood perfected their Chardonnay style a long time ago, and it works, so why would they change? The quality may vary vintage to vintage, but not by much, and the price is always everyday. The 2012 is ripe and fruity, with orange and mango flavors enhanced by sweet oak and crisp acidity.
title: Kenwood 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Yes, this blend of Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay, French Colombard and Muscat Canelli is quite sweet, with sugary flavors of oranges, peaches, vanilla and toast. And yes, some people will turn their noses up at it. Too bad for them—it's an ideal wine for drinking at the beach or picnics, or celebrating just about anything.
title: Korbel NV Sweet Cuvée Sparkling (California)

description: Delicately perfumed with bright red-fruit aromas, this is a light, fruity, forward wine that is ready to drink now. Acidity cuts through the palate and soft tannins linger on the finish.
title: Louis Chavy 2011  Bourgogne

description: You'll find lots of upfront blackberry, black currant, roasted meat and cedar flavors in this dry Malbec. It's a little soft, but easy to drink now, especially with beef.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2010 Valley View Vineyard Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine has a pretty, honey-like element to the nose that is backed by chamomile tea and dried herbs. The ensemble gives it interesting personality and a clean, fresh dimension.
title: Mionetto NV Sergio Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: You'll appreciate the harmony and cheerful personality of this luminous Prosecco. Riva dei Fiori is redolent of peach blossom and white stone and has a smooth, creamy quality with the staying power and persistence to stand up to leek quiche or other oven-cooked appetizers.
title: Montesel NV Riva dei Fiori Brut  (Prosecco di Conegliano e Valdobbiadene)

description: Soft fruit that shows velvet tannins and a full, ripe red berry character. There are milk chocolate and bitter cherry flavors and very fresh acidity, all comfortably integrated, just finishing with an edge of pepper.
title: Fischer 2005 Classic Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: An unusual Nuits-St.-Georges. Normally the wines are dark, dry and tannic. But this is fruity, light, fresh. With its vibrant red fruits, it seems very out of character, if pleasing.
title: Henri de Villamont 2005  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Stone fruit and pear appear immediately on the nose of this luminous sparkler, which also offers dimension and personality. As a Brut, the wine tastes soft and full of fruit flavors and has creamy peach on the finish.
title: Valdo NV Cuvée di Boj Brut  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: With a fresh but earthy nose of flowers, honey and herbs, this approachable white begs for food pairing. Simple but balanced and with a flirty character, it has a summer sipping kind of appeal.
title: VinArte 2004 Alb de Murfatlar Pinot Gris (Murfatlar)

description: Entirely barrel-fermented in older barrels, this wine nevertheless shows plenty of buttered toast aromas to go with its tropical fruit. It's broad in the mouth, medium-bodied and turns citrusy on the finish.
title: Wente 2006 Morning Fog Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Lightly perfumed, this wood-aged wine has soft tannins and an unfocused character, which brings spice as well as green fruits. The aftertaste is taut and earthy.
title: Winkler-Hermaden 2005 Reserve Pinot Noir (Südoststeiermark)

description: This is a pretty, luminous straw-colored sparkler with subtle shadings of honey, stone fruit, white flower and mineral. The wine is crisp and drying in the mouth but it also imparts a slight sensation of sweetness in the form of peach flavors.
title: Zonin NV Olive Garden Brut  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: Fruity and fresh, this is a sweet-smelling, but not over-the-top Prosecco Dry with measured aromas of chopped fruit salad, kiwi and citrus. The wine offers an easy, fresh approach and ends with a long trail of sweet fruit.
title: Andreola Orsola NV Millesimato Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: Nice berry aromas feature a smidgen of spice and herbs, while the palate has forward acidity that props up lively berry flavors. Expect no frills and this big-format Merlot will satisfy. It's ripe and sweet, and overall it's done right.
title: Antonio Cesar Cavalli 2006 White Pearl Merlot (Mendoza)

description: For two years running this Torrontes is White Pearl's most praiseworthy wine. It is true and tasty, with flowery aromas leading to flavors of lychee, papaya, melon and grass. Decent body and length give it credibility as a 1.5L Best Buy.
title: Antonio Cesar Cavalli 2007 White Pearl Torrontés (Salta)

description: This semisweet blend of Malvasia and Viura is not everyday stuff, but if you have a taste for something sweet and different, give it a try. The nose is floral and waxy, while flavors of honey and ultraripe pineapple are heady and sugary. Not a drop-dead winner but unique and interesting.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2006 Diamante Semi-Sweet Malvasia-Viura White (Rioja)

description: Fragrant and fresh, this is a luminous and creamy sparkler with frothy foam and persistent perlage. The wine is flatter and broader in the mouth than most and has a smooth but thick texture.
title: Carpenè Malvolti NV Cuvée Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Conegliano)

description: Drying mineral tones are backed by stone fruit and chamomile to shape a linear and tonic Prosecco Brut with bright acidity and lively effervescence. The wine would pair well with pasta salad and appetizers.
title: Domenico de Bertiol NV Brut  (Prosecco di Conegliano)

description: Elegant, light and easy to drink, this offers a nose of fresh citrus and clean, friendly flavors of lemon and spice on the palate. Uncomplicated and fun, it's a great summer wine that will pair perfectly with grilled fish or Asian cuisine.
title: Lafazanis 2006 Roditis (Peloponnese)

description: There's an unusual tone of ash or mineral on the nose of this luminous Prosecco that adds one more aromatic layer over the fresh fruit tones and honey underneath. It's a distinctive wine with tonic intensity and lingering notes of talc powder on the finish.
title: L'Antica Quercia 2007 Arió Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Conegliano)

description: In the new wave of light, fresh Grüner Veltliner, this charming, friendly wine is all lifted green fruits, crisply fresh, just touched by a structure of fresh apple skins. Screwcap.
title: Loimer 2007 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Delicate, subdued and feminine, here is a luminous sparkler with pretty floral tones and light shadings of stone fruit and melon. You'll love its delicate, creamy texture and long peachy finish.
title: Malibràn NV Gorio Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: There's a unique peppermint-like element to the nose that rides over aromas of chopped mint, basil and spring flower. This Prosecco is unlike others in its category and has a lean, compact texture accented by spearmint flavors and persistent bubbling.
title: Moletto NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: Fragrant floral tones and drying mineral notes characterize this luminous Prosecco Brut. The sparkling wine delivers frothy peach, herbal accents and a steady dose of citrus zest.
title: Sommariva NV Brut  (Prosecco di Conegliano)

description: Upfront and immediate fragrances of sweet honey and acacia flower make this extremely aromatic.   The wine is bursting with sweet fruit freshness, creamy foam and sweet peach pie. It's also one of the best priced sparklers we've seen this year.
title: Toffoli NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Conegliano e Valdobbiadene)

description: Appealing aromas of berry and pepper spice lead this likeable Merlot from Romania. Integrated but somewhat simple, the wine nontheless has an overall elegant character and tannins with enough chew to temper aging. An interesting choice from an emerging (to the U.S.) wine region.
title: VinArte 2001 Villa Zorilor Red Paradox Merlot (Dealu Mare)

description: A floral, aromatic wine, with flavors of crisp lemon and orange peel, green apple skins and grapefruit. There is just a hint of pepper in the aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: Zimmermann 2007 Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: A soft, luscious Zin, dry and firm in tannins, with forward flavors of raspberries, cherries, almond biscotti, mocha and dusty spices. Drink now.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2004 Old Vine Zinfandel (Redwood Valley)

description: El Coto has gotten its game in gear in recent years. The brand's value-priced wines like this Viura are clean and proper. In this case, opening aromas of stone and lime yield to green fruits and cucumber. The wine is easy and fresh, with a juicy, simple mouthfeel.
title: El Coto 2007 Viura (Rioja)

description: This medium- to full-bodied Shiraz starts off with aromas that suggest cured meats and slightly stewed plums, while the flavors are even meatier, picking up some citrusy notes. Crisp acids accentuate some drying tannins on the finish, giving this wine a somewhat stern demeanor. Imported by McWilliam's of Coonawarra.
title: McWilliam's of Coonawarra 2002 Brand's Laira Vineyards Shiraz (Coonawarra)

description: Oaky influences give this wine a candied taste of caramel and lime pie, on top of the grapier flavors of pineapples and pears. It's solidly in the mode of what Americans want in a Chardonnay.
title: 10 Knots 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Peach and pear flavors entwine with intense, youthful acidity in this bone-dry wine. It is taut and still developing fuller, fruity character. Very fresh, it needs time; drink from 2016.
title: Alliance Loire 2014 Demoiselle Bleue  (Saumur)

description: Made from organically grown fruit, this wine is young, with ripe red fruits and a smoky, tangy character. Intense red fruits and acidity keep it fresh. Structured and with tannins that are still boisterous, this wine will develop. It needs time, so drink from 2017.
title: Alliance Loire 2014 Demoiselle Bleue  (Saumur-Champigny)

description: Plum and raspberry aromas are modest on the nose. This everyday Tempranillo feels a bit choppy and edgy, while plum, raspberry and prune flavors end slightly bitter.
title: Bocopa 2014 Conde de Alicante Selección Tempranillo (Alicante)

description: Aromas of green apple, melon and grape skins lead to fresh, lightly spritzy tropical flavors. It doesn't entirely stand up on its own but should perk up nicely with baked fish.
title: Boomtown 2014 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine is light cherry-red in color, showing some bricking. Strawberry, bubble gum and orange-peel aromas are followed by off-dry flavors with a broad feel.
title: Finn Hill 2014 Blondie Rosé of Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

description: Nearing greenish-yellow in the glass, this wine offers lemon curd, a touch of oak and a flash of white peach on the nose. Golden apple and iodine flavors show on the palate, which proves more bitter and sour than ripe.
title: Firestone 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: With 17% Cabernet Franc added in, this wine is leathery, rustic and tightly tannic, with a sizable presence of oak. Soft, it finishes in a thickness of black cherry and stewy plum.
title: Haywood 2011 Los Chamizal Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: Pepper, herb and dark fruit aromas lead to silky-feeling fruit and savory flavors. It doesn't stand up on its own but should fit in nicely at the dinner table.
title: Hogue 2012 Genesis Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ordinary, this is not. The medium-garnet color has a brownish rim. Aromas resemble black pepper and charred beef, while the flavors are mostly savory rather than fruity. The wine tastes like pomegranate juice, and feels firm and dry in the mouth.
title: Holly's Hill 2012 Classique Mourvèdre (El Dorado)

description: Starting out reductive, this wine has aromas of wet copper penny, fresh herbs, woodspice and dark fruit. The coffee and black fruit flavors are high octane, seeming out of balance.
