description: The aromas are up front, with barrel notes of char, vanilla, coconut and baking spice followed by cigar box. The wood really shows through on the palate as well, with the tannins bringing a strong sense of astringency.
title: Castillo De Feliciana 2013 Reserve Red Wine Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Organic grapes go into this light and fruity wine with its unexpected animal name. It is soft with bright red-berry fruits that are cut with acidity. The wine is dry with strong citrus flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Château Barbanau 2016 La Girafe Verte Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a rich wine, just beginning to mature. With berry fruits, some firm tannins and acidity, the wine is ripe, still showing some stalkiness and with a dry firm aftertaste. Drink starting from 2018.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a crisp fruity wine with delicious red currants. It has fine acidity as well, with a burst of freshness in the midst of the spicy, ripe wine. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée du Lion Rosé (Var)

description: This is a soft wine. Its rounded fruits and texture are gentle and smooth with a touch of caramel. The blend, dominated by Cinsault, gives a light spicy character as well as an attractive crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Le Cloître Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lean and linear, this offers white spring flower and citrus impressions. It's simple but well made and refreshing.
title: Collavini 2015 Fumat Sauvignon (Collio)

description: Subdued acacia flower, toasted nut and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the nose while the palate offers yellow apple skin flavors and a hint of citrus zest. Bitter almond marks the lean finish.
title: Corte Adami 2015 Vigna della Corte  (Soave)

description: Here's a lively, informal white redolent of green apple, peach and citrus, with vibrant acidity. It's simple but well made, with a crisp, refreshing finish.
title: Corte Giara 2016  Soave

description: Full bodied, dry and warmly fruity, this ripe-tasting and lush-textured wine has just enough tannin to add a little grip to each sip.
title: Cupcake 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: In Cahors terms, a wine labeled Tradition is the entry-level wine of an estate, often unoaked as it is here. The wine successfully relies on the bold blackberry fruits and balanced acidity. With tannins forming a fine background, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Cause 2013 Tradition Malbec (Cahors)

description: This wine balances honeyed sweetness with intense acidity to give a wine that would be best as an apéritif. It is light and poised, finishing crisp with orange-marmalade flavors.
title: Domaine Guillaman 2015 Frisson d'Automne White (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Exotic fruit, grapefruit and tomato vine scents follow through to the lean, lively palate, along with a hint of green melon. Racy acidity leaves a crisp, clean finish.
title: Fattori 2016 Runcaris  (Soave)

description: A Bordeaux-style blend, it's half Merlot, the rest split between the Cabs. Suggestions of sweaty, funky aromas lead into a core of sweet candied fruit. It's a bit disjointed, fine for glugging, not for keeping.
title: Grizzly Peak 2013 Rogue Rouge Red (Rogue Valley)

description: Simple aromas of Juicy Fruit gum lead to a fresh palate with light rubbery tannins. The flavor of pink grapefruit is singular, with mild bitterness setting in on a citric finish. This is lively but not an enamel peeler.
title: Hiruzta 2016 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)

description: Baked aromas of raisin are not uncommon for this winery's reds. This has Amarone-like weight backed by flavors of prune, black pepper and medicinal cherry. Heat is a factor on a grapy finish. This Cabernet-Malbec blend doesn't tread lightly.
title: Casarena 2014 Sinco Red (Luján de Cuyo)

description: This Merlot-based rosé is a bit on the sweet side. It's juicy and simple, with red plum fruit that finishes with enough acidity for balance.
title: Kate Radburnd 2015 Berry Burst Rosé (Hawke's Bay)

description: The wine is smooth, soft and bland. The fruitiness and light acidity give it a crisp edge to what is otherwise a lightly textured wine. The strawberry fruits bring out a gentle aftertaste.
title: Château des Bertrands 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Intense rose, iris and aromatic herb aromas are the highlight of this wine. The palate isn't as expressive, offering raw sour cherry, powdered sage and excruciatingly astringent tannins that dry out the mouth. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak.
title: Negro Giuseppe 2013 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

description: The wine smells and tastes like fresh, crisp pippin apples, has a lively, refreshing texture and soothing fruity aftertaste.
title: One Leaf 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Hints of smoked nuts and vanilla spice lend dimension to this soft supple cherry bomb. Semisweet and low in alcohol, it's a dependable porch sipper with a subtle edge of savoriness.
title: P.J. Valckenberg 2014 Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)

description: Deep cherry-red in the glass, this wine proffers a bouquet of strawberry, coffee bean and anise. It is very bright for a red wine and a touch tart, with flavors of cranberry, eucalyptus and mocha. Almost imperceptible tannins linger through the zesty finish.
title: Pasaeli 2014 6N Red (Aegean)

description: Apricot blush in color, this wine has aromas of tangerine and strawberry. Flavors of tangerine, orange blossom and grapefruit persist into the bright finish.
title: Pasaeli 2015 Seahorse Rosé Çalkarası (Aegean)

description: Soft red fruits dominate this only lightly structured wine. It is more about juicy Pinot Noir, fruity with raspberry and red-currant flavors. Dryness at the core of the wine adds shape. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014  Bourgogne

description: Though the vineyard sits at 1,100 feet, hints of tropical fruits give this wine a ripe feel. Pineapple and mango mingle with crisper citrus flavors, yielding a wine that is both fresh and ripe. Drink now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: With a high percentage of Malvasia in the blend, the wine has an attractive floral character that softens and fills out the mineral texture. It is crisp while ripe, finishing with vibrant acidity. Drink now.
title: Poças 2015 Poças White (Douro)

description: Azal is one of most widely planted vines in Vinho Verde. It gives an attractive wine, with high acidity. This wine is crisp with lemon and with a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Azal (Vinho Verde)

description: This opens with aromas of French oak, toast, menthol and coconut while the lean palate offers mint and a hint of dark spice. It lacks fruit richness while bracing tannins grip the finish.
title: Raineri Gianmatteo 2012  Barolo

description: This sturdy, homespun red blend of 65% Syrah, 20% Zinfandel and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon pushes spicy cherry flavors ahead of earthy tannins set on a bed of rock. It's a fine, all-purpose barbeque red.
title: Raylee 2014 Syn Red (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: While jasmine and tropical fruit aromas show nice concentration on the nose, there's a bit of a chemical undertone. The weighty palate in punchy in character, with Juicy Fruit gum, banana and canned peach flavors.
title: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

description: This Malbec-Cabernet Franc blend is topped with heavy oak that lends a burnt, chemical character to the nose. Tight across the palate, with hard tannins, this tastes dry and oaky, with barrel-driven berry and cassis flavors. Dry, woody, edgy and a touch hot on the finish.
designation: B Black Legion Special Blend Old Vines
title: Bodega Goulart 2011 B Black Legion Special Blend Old Vines Malbec-Cabernet Franc (Luján de Cuyo)

description: This intentionally spritzy wine is crafted for immediate drinking. The fruit flavors fall under the heading generic white wine. Best enjoyed chilled, perhaps with toasted almonds or a soft cheese.
title: Henry Estate 2015 Müller-Thurgau (Umpqua Valley)

description: A lemon flavored wine that is soft and fruity. With its zesty, tight texture and really crisp acidity, the wine is lively and crisp. Drinkable now, it will be better from early 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Lois White (Alentejano)

description: An aroma like fresh-baked bread and flavors like tart apple and nutmeg mean this medium-bodied wine is subtle in a good way, and has a bright mouth-feel. The Jack on the label is golfer Nicklaus, for whom this wine was bottled.
title: Jack's House 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Round and smooth, this rich wine has the right acidity for the ripe pear, green plum and thrust of citrus. A backbone of minerality gives structure, while a spicy nutmeg note complements the subtle nutty character. Drink now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Vinified in new 500-liter oak barrels, this wine is fresh, fruity and crisp. It has attractive acidity, a strong streak of minerality and lively lemon fruit. With a taut, nervy edge, the wine has a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Dark berry, toasted hazelnut and menthol aromas lift out of the glass. The tightly wound palate is still rather closed and on the lean side in terms of fruit richness, but slowly reveals sour cherry, licorice and a note of ground pepper. A tannic backbone provides structure.
title: Josetta Saffirio 2012  Barolo

description: Light-gold in color, this blend of three indigenous grapes and a small amount of Chardonnay has a gentle aroma of citrus fruits and white flowers. On the palate there is also a nice interplay of citrus and flowers, with flavors of lemon, lime and orange blossom. The finish is marked with a note of salinity.
title: Turasan 2014 Selda White (Cappadocia)

description: Oily citrus aromas are round and briny. This feels front-loaded, meaning there isn't much depth to the palate. Short, lightly stalky apple and citrus flavors turn pithy on the finish.
title: Verum 2015 Chardonnay (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: This soft wine features attractive citrus and creamed-apple flavors. It is round, full, lightly spicy and presents an easy, immediately drinkable character.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: With its light prickle on the tongue and mineral texture, this is a crisp, dry wine. It is floral with pineapple and bright apple flavors. The acidity and the tangy orange zest all add to the freshness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Vila Nova 2015 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: A pop of peach and candied banana emerge from the glass. There's a nice roundness to the palate that's held in check by a lively stream of acidity, with additional notes of banana and a hint of butter.
title: Bending Branch 2015 Comfortage Hoover Valley Vineyard Roussanne

description: This new Pinot is quite light in color, and hits the palate with a mix of tart cranberry and bitter herb. In 2012, a fruit-forward vintage, it seems slightly underripe, and thins out quickly.
title: Bernard Machado 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This cool, mineral-textured wine has crisp fruit. It is refreshing while still tight, with a firm structure. It likely will remain nervy, taut and dominated by citrus. Drink from 2017.
title: Camille Paquet 2014 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: While the wine is rich and fruity, it also a cool, crisp edge that comes from the nearby ocean. Red-berry fruits are shot through with acidity and a dry core of tannin. The pepper and spice flavor probably comes from the high alcohol.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 What Else? Red (Lisboa)

description: In the same family since 1835, this estate in Pouilly-Fuissé also makes wines in other surrounding appellations. This wine, with its soft and full white fruit, gentle structure and just enough acidity, is developing fast and will be ready from late 2016.
title: Château Vitallis 2015 En Paradis  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: This bright, lemony wine is lightly mineral as well as fruity. A crisp apple character gains even more tightness from a shot of lime juice. The wine is ready to drink, light and refreshing with a buttery aftertaste.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2014 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: A minuscule amount of this wine was made, all of it fermented entirely in stainless steel. The result is lively in mouthcoating acidity and refreshing swirls of light-bodied mandarin orange and lime.
title: Passaggio 2014 New Generation Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich and full in the mouth, this dense wine is focused on ripe white and yellow fruits that are lifted by acidity. The wine is concentrated and tangy, cut with a steely aftertaste. Drink from2017.
title: Pierre Prieur et Fils 2014 Domaine de Saint-Pierre  (Sancerre)

description: Aromas of espresso, underbrush, leather, dark spice, mature black-skinned fruit and a suggestion of oak lead the way. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha, vanilla and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins that leave a dusty finish.
title: Pietranera 2010 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: The blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot and 15% Malbec has well-balanced tannins and scents of black raspberry, vanilla and caramel. Sweet vanilla, cherry pie and blueberries are the predominant tastes.
title: Purcari 2012 Rosu de Purcari Red (Moldova)

description: This untraditional blend works well, with the leathery 25% Merlot component restraining the boisterous fruit of the 75% Zinfandel. The nose mixes gravel, black-cherry blossom, mint and black cardamom, while the palate is both ripe and grippy, with olallieberries, plum-skin tannins, woody elderberries and vanilla bean. It's quite complex and dynamic.
title: HammerSky 2012 Open Invite Red (Paso Robles)

description: Complex and well balanced, this wine shows enticing aromas of fruits, spices and subtle herbs followed by tangy, dry, and slightly lean flavors like cranberry and rhubarb. It will be great with a roast fowl of some kind and should mellow more with time. Best after 2018.
title: Hirsch 2012 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Blended from grapes from a range of different soils, this open, generous wine has richness and a structure that comes from the ripe apple and gooseberry fruits. The wine is textured and deserves to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean Pabiot et Fils 2014 Domaine des Fines Caillottes  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: Leafy underbrush, scorched earth, porcini mushroom and dried plum aromas lead the nose. The firmly structured palate offers dried black cherry, raspberry confiture and licorice alongside assertive, tightly-packed tannins. Drink 2018–2024.
title: Lazzeretti 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: In a small field of excellent Cavas, this bready, leesy, semi-rich bottling stands out for its totality and comfort on the palate. Along the road are aromas of burnt banana and toasted bread along with flavors of arugula, lime and dried apple. An elegant finish with stone-fruit and green-herb notes is sophisticated.
title: Llopart 2010 Leopardi Brut Nature Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: Caramelized oak makes a statement in this wine that starts out richly and roundly, but finds a sense of balanced acidity in the glass. Medium bodied, it features classic notes of Meyer lemon and Gravenstein apple.
title: Terlato 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This release comes from the producer's own Durell Vineyard, specifically two blocks consistently used for this wine. Powerful ripeness and showy fruit rise on the nose and palate first, with an explosion of coconut water and burly oak. The wine was given 15 months in French oak, half of it new. Almonds, oranges and lemon rind combine before a dry finish. Drink now through 2021.
title: Three Sticks 2013 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Mounds of decadent chocolate and cassis round out a smoothly textured wine dotted in dried herb and black olive, coming together in firm tannin and integrated acidity. The finish is leathery.
title: V. Sattui 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: The cherry, herb and barrel spice aromas are quite brooding at present. The fruit flavors are all about elegance of expression, showing pleasing complexities and plenty of hang time on the finish.
title: Va Piano 2013 Lewis Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Steely and perfumed, this wine sees only 20% new French oak, remaining vibrantly fresh. Baked apple and lemon pith veer into grapefruit on the palate, with spiciness to the finish that's both brash and loud.
title: Zepaltas 2013 Babushka Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of violet, mature plum, espresso and a whiff of forest floor. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper, toast and clove while packed, fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2020.
title: Vignavecchia 2010 Vigneto Odoardo Beccari Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: With its light color and cool feel, this well-balanced wine comes from a parcel of 30-year-old vines. The smoky tannins and intense acidity give a wine that will develop well and slowly. It's still young with its red-berry fruits and fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Clement et Florian Berthier 2014 L'Inédit Pinot Noir (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: Corn chip and lightly oxidized stone-fruit and apple aromas arrive prior to a crisp, whole palate. Direct flavors of apple, herbs and white pepper don't mess around, while this tastes of citrus peel and related pith on a finish that's tight as a drum.
title: Covides NV Gran Gesta Reserva Especial Sparkling (Cava)

description: There's a lot to like in this nicely priced white, a blend of several regional vineyards. A taste of hazelnut expands on the palate to meet creamy Tahitian vanilla. Approachably round, this crowd-pleasing wine finishes in measured, integrated oak.
title: De Loach 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: What Baumard describes as a “secret blend” from its vineyards, this wine is both sweet and fresh. Honey and intense acidity are filled out with baked apple and lemon-marmalade flavors. It is ready to drink in all its fresh glory.
title: Domaine des Baumard NV Le Petit Paon White (Vin de France)

description: The name of the wine (land of the angels) is inspired by the fact that monks first planted the slope. More prosaically, it is a delightful wine, fresh and crisp with tight acidity that promises to soften to bring out the citrus and ripe pear flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Laporte 2014 La Terre des Anges  (Sancerre)

description: Ripe and creamy, this has rich pear and apple fruits lightly cut by more lemon flavors. The wine is fruity, textured with minerality and still young. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Tinel-Blondelet 2014 L'Arret Buffatte  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: Wild-berry, truffle, leather, menthol and sunbaked soil aromas lead the way. Tightly wound but ripe tannins wrap around the firmly structured palate, underscoring mature Morello cherry, black raspberry, white pepper, licorice and chopped Mediterranean herb. A subtle hint of game closes the finish. Drink 2019–2026.
title: Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Spine-tingling acidity is offset by pristine white peach and pear notes in this intensely mineral dry Riesling. An homage to Eugenia Frank, wife of Dr. Konstantin Frank, it's seemingly delicate in stature yet persistent and penetrating, finishing with cool, steely focus.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2014 Eugenia Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This savory blend of 40% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 5% Syrah opens with aromas of roasted coffee bean, leather, tobacco and dark woodland berry. The chewy palate offers juicy plum, cassis and clove alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2019.
title: Fattoria di Magliano 2012 Poggio Bestiale  (Maremma Toscana)

description: Orange blossoms, petrol and 7-Up aromas show on the soft but punchy nose from this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is texturally intriguing with a pithy grip, as dry flavors of tart apples, chalk and pink lemonade meld for a classic and age-worthy profile.
title: Fess Parker 2014 Rodney's Vineyard Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

description: Tense with acidity and dense in firm tannins, this fun, affordable wine needs time to unwind after opening. Once aired, it shares notes of black tea, licorice and a twine of leather around thick, shy fruit, most notably cranberry.
title: Floodgate 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There is a toasty aroma in this wine that comes from a premier cru next door to Chassagne-Montrachet. This toastiness continues into a spicy, toasty note. A good sense of fruitiness gives the wine a ripe and rich character that will allow it to mature well. Drink from 2017.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2012 Pitangerets Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Buy this for its balance and welcome sense of restraint that gives way to richness on the finish. Crisp apple and light citrus aromas, then nicely concentrated and similar flavors, put an attractive spin on this medium-bodied, fresh and appealing wine.
title: Bailiwick 2014 Vermentino (California)

description: Sunbaked earth, ripe berry, baking spice and a whiff of menthol meld in the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, pomegranate, star anise, mocha and a hint of tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Banfi 2011 Poggio alle Mura  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, forest floor and cooking spice aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of new leather. The chewy palate offers fleshy black cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and a hint of tobacco while polished tannins provide the framework. This is already accessible so no need to cellar it for years. Best through 2021.
title: Brunelli Martoccia 2011  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Charred, smoky aromas are dominant on the nose. Strong tannins overpower baked fruit aromas and oaky and herbal tones.
title: Viña Maipo 2012 Vitral Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: There's a preponderance of ripeness in this wine, the fruit tasting of baked blackberry and tar.
title: Wellington 2009 Estate Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

description: The wine is rounded and soft with attractive berry fruits and wood aging. It's fruity with juicy acidity, black currant freshness and a dry core that will allow it to age 2017–2018.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2011  Bordeaux

description: Tightly herbaceous, this light and crisp wine is all citrus and gooseberries, with a tangy lemon zest texture. Drink now.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The wine is ripe, soft and spicy. It has a rustic feel, disclosing earthy aromas and almond and spice flavors. Light acidity keeps the wine fresh, although already it is showing signs of maturity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Loew 2011 Vérité Sylvaner (Alsace)

description: Rustic in character, this wine shows a bit too much alcohol, manifested by burnt and pepper notes. The acidity works hard to bring balance but ultimately is overpowered by the weight of the wine.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Hints of lemon and blossom invigorate earthier, savory tones of nuts and pressed apples in this dry, medium-bodied Pinot Blanc. It's slightly restrained on the palate, finishing briskly on a smoky walnut-skin note.
title: Heron Hill 2013 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: A quite remarkable mauve-pink in color, this offers faint cherry aromas. It's nearly sweet on the palate, with strawberries and hard red berry candy flavors.
title: Joullian 2013 Estate Rosé of Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

description: Spicy and fruity, this is a bright, fresh wine with a light touch of sweetness. Gentil is a category that blends any number of the Alsace varieties together. It's aromatic, crisp at the end while keeping softness. Drink now.
title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2012 Pfaff Gentil White (Alsace)
winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

description: Tawny fruit leather and cooked red cherries scent this brick-rimmed wine made from Baco Noir. With flavors of dried leaves and figs, it feels overtly mature for its youthful age.
designation: Old Vines Masson Place Vineyard Pulteney Farm
title: Hudson-Chatham 2013 Old Vines Masson Place Vineyard Pulteney Farm Baco Noir (New York)

description: Initially this Cab smells grassy and downright green, yet berry aromas rise up after time in the glass. An awkward, heavy palate is home to heavily oaked berry flavors that finish creamy and thick.
title: Vena Cava 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: Juicy and spicy flavors give a wine that layers fruit and ginger. Blackberries are the dominant fruit while the spice adds a bite that is almost exotic.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: A late Merlot harvest (October 19) from 22 acres, the wine was stored for 12–16 months in cement vats. Dry and extracted with a hard edge that dulls the fruit, the wine will likely stay that way.
title: Château La Claverie 2012  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The wine is ripe and soft with a body of tannin that sits uneasily within this jammy character. The blend (Merlot 75%, Cabernet Franc 25%, Malbec 5%) was aged 30% in barrel and 70% in stainless steel tanks. It is unbalanced and likely to remain so.
title: Château Le Grand Moulin 2012 Grande Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Definitely inexpensive, but for a few dollars more, one might find more fruit and texture. This is an earthy, basic quaffer that'll please mostly on price.
title: Kirkland Signature 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Blackberry and rubbery aromas are also leafy and mulchy. The syrupy mouthfeel is heavy, with baked cassis and prune flavors suggesting overripe fruit. Fig, chocolate and sawdust notes come up on a cloying finish.
title: Primus 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Toast and dried herb notes lend an oaky tone to pressed apple and pear flavors on this Seyval Blanc. It's dry and full bodied in style, with a bright, lemon-focused midpalate that finishes a bit sour and woody.
title: Six Mile Creek 2012 Seyval Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: Ripe and juicy, this smooth, simple wine is ready to drink. Juicy black currant fruits are polished by the wood aging.
title: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2011  Bordeaux

description: Refreshing but very reserved in flavor, this wine is clean and basic. With a watery color, neutral aromas and flavors, and medium body, the effect is unassuming.
title: Entwine 2012 Pinot Gris (California)

description: This light wine feels bubbly in the mouth and slightly sweet. It has mild pear and apple flavors, a soft texture and short finish. Could be a good one to use as a substitute for Moscato.
title: Barefoot Refresh NV White (California)

description: The wood aging dominates this toasty, burnt-flavored wine. The light stalky fruit barely shows. Maybe when the tannins soften in 2015, it will be more approachable.
title: Hubert Meyer 2012 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Oily white-fruit aromas are basic, while the palate has a round mouthfeel and decent acidity. Flavors of brine, white melon rind and citrus finish pickled and bitter.
title: Terrapura 2013 Chardonnay (Curicó Valley)

description: The over-exuberance of wood aging spoils this wine. With strong spice and equally tannic elements, it's all about the skeleton and not about the flesh of the fruit.
title: Château Mayne Guyon 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: An intensely youthful herbaceous character is at work here. The wine is full of gooseberry, lemon and pink grapefruit flavors, laced with some orange zest. It's very fresh and probably too young, so wait until late 2015.
title: Château La Rose du Pin 2013  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Along with the typical warmth of an Alentejo wine comes an earthy character that is less attractive. There are juicy rhubarb and redcurrant tones, but they are engulfed by its rustic character. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2013 Alabastro Red (Alentejano)

description: Vanilla and caramel flavors dominate this wine after 12 months in French oak. That means that the fruit is really not allowed to shine. It is firm, very dry and all about spice. A pepper flavor from the alcohol leaves a burn in the mouth.
title: Château Haut Prieur 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Francesco Spadafora makes one of the best Syrahs in Sicily and Italy. This offers beautiful aromas of dark fruit and chocolate, followed by spice, leather and tobacco accents. These aromas are well integrated, resulting in a silky, creamy mouthfeel, with long persistency.
title: Principi di Spadafora 2008 Sole dei Padri Syrah (Sicilia)

description: This expression of Nero d'Avola paints a rosy picture of the future of this indigenous variety and Sicilian winemaking in general. Aged in large casks and cement, this is elegant and fine, with an extremely polished texture. The finish is marked by a note of dried berry fruit, plus warm, earthy tones of leather and dried spice.
title: COS 2007 Contrada Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: Viognier is clearly a strong suit at Cowhorn, a biodynamic vineyard and winery in the Applegate Valley of southern Oregon. The aromatic nose is wreathed in seductive scents of flower and fruit. Flavors are a mix of citrus and stone fruits, with a taste of honey that brings added depth, but not sweetness.
title: Cowhorn 2011 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

description: A ripe, wood-aged wine, this has a wood element that's intensely spicy and toasty. The weight of the sweet plum fruit and tannins are equally powerful and concentrated. A selection of the best of Château Leret Monpezat, this will need at least five years of aging before it should be touched.
designation: Cuvée Icône du Château Leret Monpezat
title: Georges Vigouroux 2009 Cuvée Icône du Château Leret Monpezat Malbec (Cahors)

description: Though the vintage helped create a lighter-than-usual version of this benchmark Pinot, it's beautifully crafted and fully realized. Like Burgundy, it disguises its power in a framework of elegantly defined fruits, acids and polished tannins. Cherry, plum, peach pit, pineapple and lemon oil notes are all in the mix. It's a wine that invites contemplation and rewards your time and attention.
title: Bergström 2010 Bergström Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The structure of this Cabernet Sauvignon (which includes small amounts of other Bordeaux grapes) shows lots of elegance, with refined tannins and acidity, plus a tasteful application of oak. Bone dry, it bears classic blackberry and black currant flavors. It will develop over the next six years, but is drinkable now.
title: Trefethen 2009 Estate Grown Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

description: Soft yet tannic, this has a brooding quality that suggests it will benefit from some time in the cellar. It shows elaborate flavors of blackberries, plums and cola, with earthy notes of mushrooms and mulch. Good now, after decanting, and should gradually evolve in the bottle over the next 6–8 years.
title: Williams Selyem 2010 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A stunning return to the quality that was seen in 2008, this superb effort bursts onto the palate with brambly berries, sweet herbs, coffee grounds and somewhat stiff, but polished, tannins. It's complex, with a touch of earthiness and generous length. The label reads Willamette Valley, though the vineyard is in the Chehalem Mountains AVA.
title: Rex Hill 2010 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The best of a very fine flight of 2010 Pinots from Rex Hill, the La Colina offers a succulent mix of crushed flower, berry and liquid rock. The flavors meld beautifully, with vivid, lively acidity that brings a touch of grapefruit. The label reads Willamette Valley, though the vineyard is in the Dundee Hills AVA.
title: Rex Hill 2010 La Colina Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is so smooth, rich and mellow, you hardly notice how intense the tannins are. But they are hard, and lock down the flavors of black currant and black licorice, plus the complex notes of minerals, roasted game and dark spices. Drink this Malbec-based blend now after decanting and over the next six years.
title: Trefethen 2009 Dragon's Tooth Red (Napa Valley)

description: Rich, with a taut, minerally, steely texture, this wine has a fine perfumed character, with notes of white spring flower, intense quince, pear and white currant. The bright acidity adds lift to this concentrated, age-worthy effort.
title: Bründlmayer 2011 Heiligenstein Erste Lage Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Rich and concentrated, this is dominated by superripe fruit. The wine derives its weight and full body from the clay soil of the Käferberg. The tight texture and acidity shows some restraint, but this selection is about power.
title: Bründlmayer 2011 Käferberg Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Rich and fruity, this has a yellow fruit flavor that's touched by a hint of pepper. A tasty edge of acidity balances this full-bodied, concentrated wine.
title: Bründlmayer 2011 Vincents Spiegel Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Brisk acidity brightens the ripe raspberry and cherry fruit, giving it a clean, lively mouthfeel. There's a jacket of tannins, but it's fine and easy, and oak brings just the right touch of sweet toast flavor. Lovely to drink now, and it should develop bottle complexities over the next 8–10 years.
title: Williams Selyem 2010 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This rare unclassified growth from Saint-Julien has all of the elegance you would expect, and it balances firm tannins with a classic black-currant flavor. It has dark, structured tannins, with layers of wood and acidity on the fragrant finish. Keep this for many years.
title: Château Moulin de la Rose 2010  Saint-Julien

description: A smooth, wood-matured wine, this shows all of the richness of Braucol and Duras. Named “the spirit,” it is a true evocation of the rugged nature of Gaillac, with a mineral streak and a big black-fruit flavor. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Rotier 2009 L'Ame Red (Gaillac)

description: This is currently very dry and austere due to its tannins, but it's impressive for its noble structure and deep, complex flavors of blackberries, cranberries, brown sugar and spices.- With such depth and a long finish, it's clearly a cellar candidate. Don't even think about opening it until 2017, at least.
title: Gary Farrell 2009 Rochioli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Powerful and structured, with a dense texture, this is packed with dark, brooding tannins. It's intense and concentrated with damson fruit. Ready for long aging.
title: Alain Brumont 2008 Château Montus Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)

description: With its built-in ageability and instant flavor appeal, this bottling may be the favorite of all the 2010s from Bergström. It's complete and delicious, with muscle and depth—a mouth-pleasing mix of berry, cola, sandalwood and earth, plus exotic accents of incense and myrrh.
title: Bergström 2010 de Lancellotti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The Flying Pig is a blend of 60% Cabernet Franc and 40% Merlot. Bursting with a ripe, succulent cherry flavor, it offers layers of blackberry and spice, with floral highlights of talcum powder and rose. It's has a potpourri tone that dots the long, spicy finish. Perfect for ribs in a sweet barbecue sauce.
title: Cayuse 2009 Flying Pig Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: This top cuvée made by the Pelvillain family shows typical black Malbec color, and it has an opulent texture that's packed with notes of rich spice, black plum and balanced wood. While the tannins are present, the fruit offers a full, rich character. With its concentration, this will benefit from several years of aging.
title: Château de Cénac 2010 Eulalie Malbec (Cahors)

description: Rich, balanced and full bodied, this shows exuberantly ripe, sweet flavors of blackberries, mulberries, dark chocolate and raisins, with notes of exotic spices. It will last for 20 years, gradually losing fruit and growing earthy and mushroomy.
title: Williams Selyem 2010 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich and ripe, this has flavors of raspberries, cherries, cola and red currants, plus layers of exotic spices and toasty sandal-wood that change with every sniff and sip. With its silky texture and crisp acidity, it should develop over the next 6–8 years, but it's also wonderful now.
title: Williams Selyem 2010 Flax Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Very rich and smooth in texture, like pure velvet, this Bordeaux-style blend has lots of tannins that are soft, ripe and easy. It offers extraordinary waves of blackberry, black currant, dark chocolate and caramelized oak flavors. Drink soon for maximum enjoyment.
title: Martin Ray 2009 Synthesis Red (Napa Valley)

description: The Petit Manseng grape gives a honeyed, ripe and fragrant wine. Made from late-harvest fruit, this shows notes of pineapple and creamed apple. It should age well over many years.
title: Domaine Cauhapé 2010 Noblesse du Temps  (Jurançon)

description: The blend includes 4% each Cabernet Franc and Merlot. It was aged in 80% new oak, but retains its lovely, sweetly floral nose and luscious, berry fruit flavors. Yes, there is plenty of toasty oak goodness, but it's layered in with the fruit and soil flavors. Overall, this is a thoroughly enjoyable bottle right now, with a good decade or more of aging potential.
title: Ellanelle 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Big, deep and hard in tannins, this wine shows the estate's power and concentration, bearing blasts of cherries, currants, persimmons and cola. The flavors are pinpointed with laserlike focus, with hints of cocoa powder and tamari. It should begin to open by 2017, and develop for many years afterward.
title: Sea Smoke 2010 Ten Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The pretty fragrance comes with cotton candy highlights, along with a note of tangy red fruit. It's concentrated and deep, with appealing purity of flavor and the structure to age for over a decade.
title: Bergström 2010 Temperance Hill Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Made using fruit from one of the top Kamptal vineyards, this perfumed wine has great texture, with tight acidity and notes of green plum skin and lemon zest. With its depth of flavor and nervy, minerally edge, it will age for at least four years.
title: Bründlmayer 2011 Steinmassel Erste Lage Riesling (Kamptal)

description: Aromas of sugared plum and other blue fruit take the lead followed by cocoa and herbs. The coffee and plum flavors are soft and sweet, going down easy.
title: Diversion 2012 Merlot (Washington)

description: This lively, crisp wine gives both intense acidity and great fruitiness. It's bright, with a line of fresh red currant flavors that are delicious and drinkable right now.
title: Domaine Houchart 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This intensely fruity wine revels in its red berry fruits, crisp acidity and general enjoyment of being a summer rosé. It's lively with acidity and a light tang to freshen the aftertaste.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2014 Simone Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rose, violet, toast, underbrush, menthol and perfumed berry aromas lead the way on this wine. The palate offers dried black cherry, eucalyptus, ground black pepper and dried sage alongside bracing, rather astringent tannins.
designation: Vigna Lama della Villa Gran Selezione
title: Fattoria di Lamole 2010 Vigna Lama della Villa Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

description: Aromas of spiced plum, coffee, toast and vanilla lead the nose on this blend of Sangiovese and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate delivers dried black cherry, roasted coffee bean, black pepper and licorice alongside brooding, tongue-drying tannins. Drink 2016–2021.
title: Fattoria San Felo 2011 Dicioccatore Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This 100% varietal wine comes off as quite ripe. Aromas of woodspice and caramel lead to full-bodied, sweet and quite boozy cherry flavors, with grainy tannins backing it all up.
title: Gifford Hirlinger 2012 Estate Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This opens with aromas of resin, nail polish remover, spiced plum and a whiff of cellar floor. The palate offers dried black cherry, clove, menthol and ground pepper alongside firm, drying tannins. This is evolving quickly so drink soon.
title: Godiolo 2009  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: The oak, a mixture of French, American and Hungarian (with 50% new), takes the lead, with aromas of vanilla bean and toffee out in front of coffee and plum. The flavors are full bodied, sweet and generous, backed by grainy tannins.
title: Goose Ridge 2011 Estate Bottled Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light hints of herbs and fynbos add character to the green melon, plum and grapefruit pith aromas. The palate follows with more of the same, in addition to accents of green plantain and lime leaf. This is direct and lifted, with a clean, brisk finish. Enjoy now.
title: Mulderbosch 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Forward aromas of savory herbs and fynbos add character to the black cherry and berry core of this wine. It's well balanced, with medium tannins, ample acidity and a crushed-satin texture. Soft hints of toasted oak and mocha unfold on the medium-length close.
title: Spice Route 2012 Pinotage (Swartland)

description: Aromas of mature black fruit, tobacco and a hint of leather lead the nose on this structured blend of Sangiovese and 15% Alicante Bouschet, Merlot and Cabernet. The palate delivers dried cherry, licorice and espresso alongside tightly knit, chewy tannins.
title: Massi di Mandorlaia 2011 Mandorlaia Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: A blend of Syrah and Sangiovese, this salmon-colored wine opens with aromas of peach blossom and honeysuckle. The palate doles out juicy red cherry, nectarine, pink grapefruit and a hint of Mediterranean herb alongside zesty acidity.
title: Mazzei 2013 Belguardo Red (Toscana)

description: Roasted hazelnut with grilled pineapple and peach carry the aromas and palate of this vineyard-designate Chardonnay. Having spent 11 months in French oak (33% new), the wine shows barrel tones, however a bright acidity helps keep things alive and fresh.
title: Michael Shaps 2013 Wild Meadow Vineyard Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, underbrush and tobacco lead the nose on this full-bodied wine. The ripe, dense palate offers black cherry, cassis, clove and dried hay alongside round tannins.
title: Morisfarms 2011  Monteregio di Massa Marittima

description: Here's a refreshing white that offers wispy aromas of white flower and stone fruit. The palate is more expressive thanks to green apple, nectarine, fresh herb and bitter almond. Bracing acidity gives it a vibrant, focused feel.
title: Mormoraia 2014  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

description: Rounded flavors of ripe, red apple play about the palate and make for very appetizing if light-bodied drinking. Refreshment is the key factor, as is fruity exuberance. Drink soon.
title: Münzenrieder 2014 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)

description: This 100% varietal wine offers aromas of barrel spices, mint, dried fruit and barnyard. It's full bodied but still shows good deftness.
title: :Nota Bene 2011 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: The wood and alcohol seem to get out front of aromas of plum, raspberry and medicine cabinet. Flavors are sweet and concentrated with a tart, cranberry-filled finish. A lot of good things are going on but they don't quite seem to all come together.
title: Obelisco Estate 2012 BDX Merlot (Red Mountain)

description: Delicate white peach and pear notes perfume this dry, crisply fruity wine. There's a satisfying weightiness to the palate, but tart lemon notes keep it zesty and spry.
title: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Reserve Pinot Gris (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This opens with aromas of toast, oak, orchard fruit and a confectionary note. The full-bodied palate offers candied citrus, nectarine and vanilla alongside bright acidity. A note of white almond marks the finish.
title: Palagetto 2011 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

description: Made from a cool, steep site near the tiny town of Occidental, this white is lemony crisp and quite austere. A food-friendly wine suggestive of star fruit and just-ripe pineapple, it finishes somewhat spicy.
title: Paul Mathew 2013 Weeks Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A solid value, this wine contains organoleptic cues reminiscent of Dr. Pepper: cola, cherry and spice. It's medium bodied, with a slightly open-knit but soft texture. Drink now–2016.
title: Ribbonwood 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Light and clear in color and texture, this wine opens in dirt and earth, along with a touch of baked strawberry. Smooth, juicy and long-lasting, it shows off the vintage's warmer leanings, and is medium bodied and densely lengthy.
title: Roadhouse Winery 2012 Green Label Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Marked by crunchy, just-ripe cherry fruit and some slightly herbal shadings, this nonetheless offers solid value. Thyme and bay notes add nuance, as does the silkiness on the finish. Ready to drink.
title: Sacred Hill 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Aromas of green apple and orchard blossom are brightened by lemon zest on the nose. The broad palate brings ample weight, balanced by lemony acidity, with ripe melon and peach leading the way.
title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2013 Founder's Reserve Chardonnay (Shenandoah Valley)

description: Citrus and green pear combine with yeasty notes to give an impression of subdued but creamy fruitiness. It's an easy-drinking, savory and versatile white, with some peppery spice.
title: Soellner 2014 Fumberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)

description: Blended with Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this wine offers barrel-dominant aromas, with notes of coffee, vanilla and woodspice. The raspberry and cranberry flavors are quite ripe and luscious.
title: Terra Vina Wines 2012 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Like most 2012 Marlborough Pinots, this is crisp, with pie cherry fruit leading the way. Hints of campfire and button mushrooms add welcome complexity, ending on a long, mouthwatering note of tart fruit.
title: Dog Point 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Straightforward and refined, this presents a fruity aroma of wild berry and suggestion of Mediterranean brush. The smooth palate offers wild cherry and a hint of savory herb alongside supple tannins and bright acidity.
title: Val delle Rose 2013  Morellino di Scansano

description: A field of mint is found on the nose of this soft, spicy wine with the gimmicky name, around a core of red cherry and touch of oak. Fresh and bright, it has a suggestion of heft on the finish.
title: Woodenhead 2011 Wet Kiss Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lively, fruity wine that is fragrant and fresh. Having no sugar and bone dry, it is as crisp as an apple. A bright mousse offers a fine fruity texture and a light, citrus aftertaste.
title: Zusslin NV Brut Zéro Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Here's a forward and friendly selection, made from Sangiovese and other native grapes. It offers a floral nose of violet and iris, with delicious wild cherry and spice flavors. This is ready to drink, so enjoy soon.
title: Il Conventino 2011  Rosso di Montepulciano

description: Lush, ripe wine, full of black fruits and a generous texture. The wine is soft, just a hint of dryness to give it weight and density. Berry fruits, black plums and acidity promise some aging.  Drink from 2014.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2012 Monsaraz Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a solid effort, especially at this price point. The cherry-cola core of flavor grabs your interest quickly, and hangs on with a hint of tobacco in the smooth finish. Some nice acidity adds a touch of minerality.
title: Corvallis Cellars 2011 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Very perfumed Riesling, full of white flowers, hedgerow fruits and fragrant acidity. There is a good granular texture to balance this fruitiness giving a ripe wine that can be drunk now.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2011 Cuvée Engel Riesling (Alsace)

description: Tasting of white grapes, this is fruity, lightly spicy and fragrant. It's a rare grape in Alsace which is a shame because its delicate, attractive fruitiness makes it a great apéritif wine.
title: Domaine Moltès 2012 Réserve Muscat (Alsace)

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a classic Pinot Blanc, rounded, soft and ripe. It has just a touch of spiced pear along with red apples, and a fine, fragrant layer of acidity.
title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2012 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: This is a lean Dominus, showing the difficulties of the vintage. It's dry and tannic, with black currant, cherry and cassis flavors that are wrapped in strong, hard tannins. It's a good wine, but lacks the r ich complexity you expect from this property.
title: Dominus 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Rancia Riserva opens with ripe plum, red currant and bell pepper aromas. The palate shows flavors of black fruit, chocolate and soy sauce alongside coffee and oak notes. It has nervous energy and intensity, but should develop nicely over the next few years.
title: Felsina 2009 Rancia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: Rich and full in character, the wine, from a small walled vineyard, has red and black berry fruits along with some good flavor depth and well integrated tannins. The wine is solid, while also offering ready-to-drink fruitiness. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2009 Clos de la Folie Cabernet Franc (Anjou)

description: This is a lovely Pinot to drink over the next several years with steak, lamb or a wild mushroom risotto. It's dry, silky and racy in acidity, with a cleansing mouthfeel. Sends tiers of sour cherry and raspberry candy, cola and white pepper across the palate, finishing long and spicy.
title: Fog Head 2011 Hillside Reserve San Bernabe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: After a whiff of iodine arises, the nose on this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon offers mostly jammy berry scents in front of a full palate containing zesty acidity. Flavors of red plum, salt, cherry and cranberry finish long and without any excess weight or push.
title: Inurrieta 2008 Altos de Inurrieta Reserva Red (Navarra)

description: Standard white-fruit and salinic aromas offer hints of apple and flower blossom. The mouthfeel is more round and full than most Basque wines, while the flavors are a blend of melon and peach. This is quiet and not overly flavorful on the finish, with a hint of seltzer and minerality.
title: Itsas Mendi 2011 No. 7 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

description: Ripe yellow and white fruits are the dominant factor in this smooth, rich wine. It has good weight, along with a juicy, lemon and zest texture. Not for aging, unlike some Pouilly Fumé, so drink over the next few months. Screwcap.
title: Joseph Mellot 2012 Le Troncsec  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: This is a prime example of clean Verdejo; the nose is minerally and neutral except for notes of nectarine and peach. A lifted, firm, well-cut palate is home to pithy flavors of nectarine, tangerine and melon, while the finish is long and tastes mildly bitter, which is common for the variety.
title: Hermanos Lurton 2012 Verdejo (Rueda)

description: This is a dry, severe Chardonnay that doesn't offer a lot of upfront pleasure. The product of a chilly vintage, it is nonetheless elegant and complex. Tart acidity gives a bright boost to the mango and pineapple flavors. Don't drink it too cold.
title: Krutz 2011 Martinelli Road Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With pink hints from the skins of the Pinot Gris this wine has honey and canned apricot syrup flavors. The spice and acidity complement each other at the end of this attractive wine.
title: Lucien Albrecht 2012 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: An elegant Syrah abundant in floral aromatics, demure in forward black and red fruit and a tinge of lavender. On the finish is pepper, the appropriate accent for a tastefully peppery meal.
title: Martin Lane Winery 2009 Estate Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Sangiovese offers earthy aromas of violet, plum, leather and meat juice. The palate delivers ripe blackberry, chocolate, orange zest, pepper and nutmeg flavors, all enveloped in smooth, round tannins.
title: Argiano 2011 Non Confunditur Red (Toscana)

description: Cassis, mineral, floral notes and aromatic subtleties hint at sophistication and maturity. This is layered and well structured, with exotic spice flavors accenting oaky red-currant and plum notes. The finish is mellow, woody and fresh feeling. Drink now.
title: Bodega Patritti 2007 Primogénito Cabernet Sauvignon (Neuquén)

description: This wine comes from Moscatel Graúdo, the most fragrant of the Moscatel family. Certainly very perfumed, it's dry with attractive acidity, and a crisp, floral and lightly spicy character.
title: Casal do Conde 2012 Quinta da Arrancosa Moscatel Graúdo (Tejo)

description: Pricey for a blush wine, but this is an excellent one, among the best rosés of the year. It's fairly dark in color and full-bodied, but very rich in strawberry and spice flavors, and the finish is smooth and dry.
title: Chiarello Family Vineyards 2012 Chiara Rosé of Zinfandel Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Another classic Gewürz from this fine winery, their best ever. As the label indicates, it's dry, but has an apparent sweetness, with honey-infused orange, Asian pear and litchee nut flavors, and those fabulous exotic spices that are so unique to the variety.
title: Claiborne & Churchill 2012 Dry Gewürztraminer (Central Coast)

description: The 2010 BlackJack is loaded with tart cranberry and pomegranate fruit flavors. There is a streak of iron and darker notes that come through in earthy, slighted roasted tannins. The complexity is intriguing and adds depth to a rather light vintage.
title: David Hill 2010 Estate BlackJack Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: You won't find many wines like this on the market today. The blend is Tai grapes with 30% Sauvignon. The bouquet is broad and intense with complex aromas of peach, apricot, cinnamon, passion fruit, toasted almond and butterscotch. In the mouth, the texture is long, creamy and soft.
title: De Stefani 2010 Olmèra White (Veneto)

description: A structured wine, packed with red fruits and delightful acidity. There is a core of dark tannin and a solid structure as well as the bright freshness at the end. Because it has this structure, it's worth aging for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine des Croix 2011  Beaune

description: Really impressive at this price for its depth of flavor and overall balance. Dry and elegantly constructed, it shows extravagant flavors of blackberries, cherries, sweet currants and sandalwood. A lovely Merlot of great charm and drinkability. Production was 5,800 cases.
title: L de Lyeth 2011 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: This big, ripe wine is well polished with a juicy, fragrant character from the spiced plums. The wood aging has resulted in deceptively soft tannins, and the delicious black fruits are still upfront. This wine could age for 2–3 years.
title: Luis Duarte 2011 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This old vines Pinot has an unusual strength of flavor. It's easily the most powerful of Lynmar's new Pinots, with deep, brooding cherry and red currant flavors that have been concentrated to syrupy intensity like a boiled-down fruit-wine sauce. It's impressive, but intensely rich. Give it 5–6 years to see if things change.
title: Lynmar 2011 Quail Hill Vineyard Old Vines Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Pricey, but it's a very good Sauvignon Blanc. You can tell right away that it's pedigreed, from the perfumed aroma to the complex flavors of citrus fruits, peaches, sweet hay, vanilla, toast and white pepper. With a dry finish, it's versatile across a range of foods.
title: Nitty Gritty 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Loaded with scents and flavors of grapefruit, this leesy, textural Pinot Gris is bracing and mouth-filling. It's definitely on the tart side, but could be paired with a wide variety of fish and poultry dishes.
title: Raptor Ridge 2012 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Soft and sweetly fruity at this time, offering ripe, candied raspberry, cherry and red currant flavors. It's a little direct and brown sugary, but shows enough stuffing that it could develop earthy, mushroomy complexities in 5–6 years.
title: Saintsbury 2010 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A sweet, slightly sugary Oregon Riesling that gives a gentle nod to the German Kabinett style. The low (8%) alcohol is the tip-off. The delicate, floral aromas and light stone-fruit flavors make this an ideal summer sipping wine.
title: Sineann 2012 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

description: This is one of the better California Tempranillos out there. It's delicate and silky on the palate, and earthy despite rich raspberry and cherry fruit. Balanced with crisp acidity and a scour of dusty tannins, it's complex enough to enjoy with a great steak, especially with mushrooms. A consistent followup to the winery's 2010.
title: Straight Line 2011 Tempranillo (California)

description: Following in the wake of the marvelously ripe 2009 Tendril, this does not carry the same weight and authority. It's well made and accurately reflects the cooler, difficult vintage. Strawberry fruit is lightly coated in chocolaty tannins; the wine remains firm and compact, with medium body and balance throughout.
title: Tendril 2010 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This lovely Ribolla Gialla offers thick richness and intensity that entices but never goes overboard. Lingering tones of peach, grapefruit and candied fruit fill in the rear.
title: Vigna Traverso 2011 Ribolla Gialla (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: A new single-vineyard product from a protagonist in the world of quality Prosecco Superiore, this Brut expression opens with frothy foam and dry aromas of talc powder, crushed mineral and white flower. The wine is sharp and defined with a blast of balanced acidity on the close.
designation: Col Credas Rive di Farra di Soligo Brut
title: Adami 2011 Col Credas Rive di Farra di Soligo Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Almost cool in character, this crisp Douro comes from high-altitude vineyards. The grapes yield a fruity citrus- and pear-driven wine that's minerally, with just the right amount of acidity to push its freshness forward.
title: Aveleda 2012 Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a bit tarry at first, but gradually opens up to reveal slightly herbal fruit notes of cassis and hints of olive and tomato—very Provençal. It's silky on the finish, so it's easy to drink now and over the next 5–6 years.
title: Domaine La Consonnière 2010 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: An easy wine to drink now, this is rich and mellow with black cherry. raspberry jam and exotic spice flavors. Feels rich in the mouth, with supportive tannins and a nice bite of acidity for balance. Not an ager, but a fine example of how Napa brings elegance to Zin's country-cousin personality.
title: Frog's Leap 2011 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: A black-hued blend of Aragonez, Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira, this is powerful, rich and firmly packed with tannins as well as dense plum and wood flavors. Accents of spice and mint add complexity. The wine will benefit from 2–3 years of aging to soften and round out, but it's drinkable now.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2011 Ciconia The Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Hoyt's 2010 Tempranillo is a huge improvement over their 2009. The fruit is riper and more focused, making the wine more balanced and interesting. Strong acids and firm tannins bracket concentrated cherry jam, red currant and bacon flavors made for drinking now.
title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2010 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

description: Solista, meaning made from one grape rather than a blend, is a new range of wines from Adega Mayor. This fresh, fruity Verdelho is perfumed, with lemon and orange-peel flavors. It's all ready to drink.
title: Adega Mayor 2011 Solista Branco Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: At just 11.2% abv, Bedell's delicate 2011 Cabernet Franc is a remarkable reflection of what good winemaking can do in a difficult vintage. Austere in profile, with tart red-cherry flavors, it's accented by violet florals and an array of mineral tones that add complexity. Soft tannins make for easy drinking.
title: Bedell 2011 Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A fragrant Roussanne that could easily convince doubters that this variety does impressively stand on its own. Exuding honeysuckle, pear and honey, it's crisp and nicely textured with a depth and weight that gives it a sense of fullness but not fat.
title: Campovida 2012 Bonofiglio Vineyard Roussanne (Mendocino County)

description: Kuwal is a Tempranillo-led blend that's ripe and structured. Cassis, plum and toasty aromas are heady and introduce a big, ripe palate with round tannins, harmony and flavors of coffee, chocolate, spice and blackberry. To no surprise, it finishes jammy and rich. Drink through 2017.
title: Tres Valles 2010 Kuwal Red (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: Extraordinarily rich and ripe in tropical fruits, oranges and honey, this Chardonnay's lushness is balanced by citrusy acids and minerality. It's very good, but you find yourself wishing it was drier and more complex for the price.
title: Walt 2011 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose on this Malbec is blue-green, meaning it deals both blueberry and boysenberry but also alfalfa and minty green aromas. The palate feels big and generous, with nice acidity and flavors of pastry, jammy blackberry, molasses and spice. Amid the layered finish, you'll find baked black-fruit flavors and light green notes.
title: O. Fournier 2008 Malbec (Uco Valley)

description: There's a musky leather note that adds intrigue to crisp black-plum notes in this mineral-intense Meritage. Moderately full in body, the palate is concentrated, with pristine fruit balanced by a kick of acidity and ripe tannins.
title: Osprey's Dominion 2007 Flight Meritage (North Fork of Long Island)

description: There is a roasted, slightly burnt scent to this wine, leading into smoky flavors of ground coffee and tar, wrapped around light red fruit.
title: Clearwater Canyon 2009 Merlot (America)

description: Delicate and light with a pale pink color and creamy white foam on the surface, this is a great little sparkling aperitivo wine to pair with spicy tapas or finger foods. Rose, raspberry and a touch of strawberry open the fragrant bouquet.
title: Cleto Chiarli 2012 Rosè Brut de Noir Sparkling (Romagna)

description: Whispers of smoke and flint on the nose of this intensely minerally Sauvignon Blanc blow off to reveal a bright, elegantly balanced wine with hints of fresh green grass and stems. It's brisk and refreshing, with an easy drinking feel.
title: Comtesse Thérèse 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Ripe and creamy, with flavors of pineapple candy, honey, brown sugar, buttered toast and cinnamon. It's just what millions of Chardonnay lovers want.
title: F.J. Serra 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: For a basic Chardonnay, this fits the bill. Citrus and peach aromas are standard and clean. The palate is tight and juicy, with no overt oak feel. Flavors of melon and pear have light spice and vanilla accents, while the finish is crisp.
title: Finca El Origen 2012 Reserva Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: There's nothing at all French about this Cab. It could only come from California, with its jammy, soft black cherry and chocolate flavors.
title: Frenchie Winery 2009 Louis XIV Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County-Napa County)

description: Lots of delicious orange flavor in this pretty wine. It's overtly sweet, but a too soft for comfort.
title: Kokomo 2012 Timber Crest Vineyard Muscat Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: The alcohol is refreshingly low on this wine, making it delicate in the mouth. It's also full of lemon, peach and vanilla flavors. Easy to drink with hors d'oeuvres.
title: Kokomo 2012 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A lightly perfumed wine, this is soft with warm strawberry flavors. The acidity and texture play a supporting role in this ripe, light-bodied wine.
title: Manuel Olivier 2010  Bourgogne

description: This is a light and fruity wine from J. Portugal Ramos. It's crisp, with lemon and citrus flavor, and bright with grapefruit acidity. Drink now and over the next year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: High-pitched, medium-intense notes of toasted wheat, black cherry, maduro and sweaty leather define the nose and palate. This is a medium-bodied wine, and it offers powdery tannins and juicy acids that support the flavors. Cherry and cocoa notes linger on the finish.
title: Jefferson Vineyards NV Petit Verdot (Monticello)

description: On this Pinot's plus side is a clean savoriness, with bright acidity highlighting raspberry, cocoa and spice flavors. On the debit side is its soft, fleshy ripeness. Drink up.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2011 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)

description: Golden yellow, with notes of fig, apricot and mint. At 23% residual sugar, it's rich and sweet, but the concentration drops off on the back half.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2009 Ice Wine Riesling

description: Produced entirely from Petite Sirah, this wine is dark in color, with notes of cherry, melon and strawberry. It's a bit ponderous but still offers enjoyment.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2011 Dry Rosé of Petite Sirah

description: Based in Nuits-Saint-Georges, Manuel Olivier has made a specialty of the wines from the Hautes Côtes in the hills behind the city. This is a light and fruity wine with freshness and some firm, dry tannins, although it's ready to drink now.
title: Manuel Olivier 2010  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Here's the quintessential Italian white wine to pair with fried calamari or mini pizzas. It offers fresh green notes of lime and garden herb, backed by peach and cantaloupe accents.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2011 Costa di Nugola Vermentino (Toscana)

description: A light, perfumed wine with soft tannins and bitter cherry fruits. There is an earthy edge here, and while the wine has brisk acidity, there's an easy texture. It's ready to drink.
title: Mommessin 2011 Le Clé Saint-Pierre  (Bourgogne)

description: Light notes of peach and dusty mineral open the bouquet of this food-friendly Soave. You could pair the wine with seafood, summer pasta dishes or salad. It ends with notes of white flower and almond blossom.
title: Pasqua 2011 Famiglia Pasqua  (Soave)

description: Made with organically-farmed Glera grapes, this sparkling Prosecco Superiore opens with subtle tones of lemon or almond blossom with slightly more sweetness than you usually get with a Brut sparkler.
title: Perlage NV Canah Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Part of Italy's Vino Naturale movement, this organically-farmed Arneis opens with a pretty hay color and subtle aromas of peach, pear and Golden Delicious apple.
title: Punset 2011 Arneis (Langhe)

description: White-fruit aromas, brine and clam shell notes get this Albariño going. The mouthfeel is full and lemony. Flavors of pickled, briny citrus and nectarine carry onto the finish. This is at its best now; in 2014 it will not be so good.
title: Ramón Bilbao 2012 Valiñas Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: This young Tempranillo shows light, pretty strawberry and tart cranberry fruit flavors. It's sharp and herbal, young and tight; a pleasant red that does not show any particularly strong varietal character.
title: Raptor Ridge 2011 Tempranillo (Oregon)

description: Sparkling wine is all about texture, and the mouthfeel on this Chardonnay-based bubbly lacks refinement. The bubbles are scoury and the finish is rough. Still, it has rich citrus, yeast, honey and pear flavors.
title: River Road NV Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: On first sniff, the scent of sulfur shrouds this wine, but it fades with air to reveal tinges of grapefruit, white pepper, honeysuckle and a legume-like quality. The flavors seem restrained from the start, but they gain intensity with time. Zesty acidity gives the palate cut.
title: Rosemont 2011 Traminette (Virginia)

description: A Cabernet Sauvignon that includes 8% Merlot, Silver Palm is dense and oaky, with round tannins and a big taste of cherry followed by a strong herbal and menthol component. Fairly priced, it's ready to be paired with rib roast.
title: Silver Palm 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This Rosé sparkling wine offers a pretty pink color and easy aromas of citrus, pink grapefruit, peach and honey. Soft, creamy foam is backed by peachy sweetness.
title: Trevisiol NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Veneto)

description: Very tropical and aromatic, this is a powerfully rich white. It is tangy with sweet oranges, layered with pineapple and apricot. There is a spicy, peppery character that comes from the alcohol.
designation: Serras de Azeitão Selecção do Enólogo
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2012 Serras de Azeitão Selecção do Enólogo White (Península de Setúbal)

description: Here's a fresh and simple Prosecco with sharp and clean perlage followed by citrus, peach, honey and even a touch of white peppercorn. This is a perfect aperitivo sparkler.
title: Bacio della Luna NV Brut  (Prosecco)

description: You can't beat the price versus quality ratio on offer here. Yes, this is an easy and thin wine, but it also delivers just enough fruit freshness and personality to pair with easy vegetable dishes or salads. Great for pool side parties or barbecues.
title: Cantina di Soave 2011 Re Midas  (Soave)

description: Le Grillaie offers easy fruit tones of cherry and blackberry with touches of cola and licorice at the back. This simple red white would pair well with a heaping plate of pasta and meat sauce.
title: Celli 2011 Le Grillaie  (Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore)

description: Friulano shows its best results in its native home—northeast Italy—where the wine expresses creamy richness followed by aromas of white peach, pear and honey. Pair it with shellfish or vegetable risotto.
title: Livio Felluga 2010 Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: This is distinguished for its deeply-rich mouthfeel and creamy aromas of stone fruit, honeydew and crushed almond. There's a point of crisp acidity that's refreshing.
title: Livio Felluga 2010 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

description: This feels dramatic from the start. It's silky and refined in texture, with brisk acidity and a bite of tannic astringency. It shows a rich core of cherry, cola and sandalwood flavors. This should hang in there over the next five years.
title: Maggy Hawk 2009 Hawkster Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Tight and focused, this has a fine core of black cherry and cassis. Layers of coffee and dark chocolate are wrapped around the fruit, and the wine is compact and textural. Excellent now, but probably better in a few years.
title: Maryhill 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An excellent Washington Malbec, this spicy delight sets up beautifully on the palate with bright, crisply defined, varietal fruit flavors of boysenberry, black cherry and cassis. Precise and penetrating, with excellent balance, it keeps the barrel flavors light and minimal.
title: Maryhill 2009 Proprietor's Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Smoky and earthy smelling, with aromas of tobacco, subtle spice and dried cherry. This feels tight, with more acidity than body at this point in its evolution. Flavors of dried raspberry, plum, earth and brown sugar are solid and classic. Drink now through 2013.
title: Bodegas Riojanas 2001 Monte Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Rusty and mature in color, with earthy, lightly leafy aromas that come with notes of maple and brown sugar. This feels elegant and fit, with classic Rioja flavors of dried red fruit, cocoa and malt. The finish is long and tasting lightly baked. Drink now.
title: Bodegas Riojanas 2001 Viña Albina Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: This passito dessert wine from the island of Lipari delivers a deep amber color, with bright aromas of resin, caramel, butterscotch, candied fruit, chestnut and honey. The mouthfeel is rich, syrupy and very sweet.
title: Cantine Florio 2008  Malvasia delle Lipari

description: Shows the impeccable viticulture and winemaking talent that mark all of Jarvis's red wines. The tannins and acidity are considerable, giving the cherry flavor such a nice bite. A lovely wine to drink now with steak or Italian-inspired beef dishes.
title: Jarvis 2010 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Tempranillo (Napa Valley)

description: This cool-climate Chardonnay offers beautiful aromas of white peach, honey, apricot and exotic fruit. It's silky but fresh mouthfeel should pair with shellfish or sophisticated Thai dishes. Very nice.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2008 Giovanelli Chardonnay (Alto Adige)

description: Rich and rounded, this has notes of spice and ripe white and yellow fruit. Immediately attractive, it has complex acidity and a zesty texture. This should be ready to drink in 6 months. Screwcap.
title: Loimer 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: Ottomino consistently has success with this single-vineyard Zinfandel. As always, it's dry, smoothly tannic and complex, with flavors of wild berry, tobacco, chocolate and spice.
title: Ottimino Vineyards 2008 Rancho Bello Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: Estate grown, this 100% Syrah has excellent concentration and round, mouthfilling fruit flavors. Cherries and plums are highlighted with baking spices and a finishing wash of rich mocha. Very tasty, forward, and drinking at its best right now.
title: Plumb Cellars 2008 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Good concentration and clear varietal flavors mark this excellent Washington Mourvèdre. The mixed red fruits are well integrated, with a strong vein of mineral, and a finishing wash of vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Lots of barrel flavors to be sure, but the fruit can take it.
title: Robert Ramsay 2009 McKinley Springs Vineyard Mourvèdre (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Rich and smooth, this wine shows weight with superripe fruit that offers a mellow take on Grüner. With its spice, pineapple and dried apricot flavors, this is both fruity and structured.
title: Stift Göttweig 2010 Gottschelle Erste Lage Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: There's a glimpse of dried herb and rosemary behind more intense aromas of black fruit, cherry and leather. This rich wine is concentrated and persistent, and it should pair well with stewed meat dishes.
title: Tenute Soletta 2007 Keramos Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: A successful expression of Sauvignon Blanc, this has good structure, density and staying power. It delivers stone fruit, citrus, pear, exotic fruit flavors, with touches of spice and green herb on the crisp close.
title: Lis Neris 2010 Picol Sauvignon Blanc (Friuli Isonzo)

description: There's great richness to the nose, with a seriously decadent and robust apple-pie aroma. The palate shows a bit more balance and restraint, with ripe flavors of fig and melon fleshing out the creamy texture but staying bright thanks to lifting acidity. The evolving finish transitions from fruit to spice and finally ends on a citrus pith flavor.
title: Rudera 2009 Platinum Chenin Blanc (Elgin)

description: Ripe fruit flavors of berry and plum are enveloped in spice-cake highlights. The citrus-infused acids bring in a hint of grapefruit and lemon. This is a complex wine, with fascinating components, and beginning to pull itself together.
title: Sparkman 2009 Darkness Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a five-grape blend, with leafy flavors of garden-fresh herbs as well as ripe strawberries and vanilla cream. It's a smooth and immediately pleasing wine, with a velvety finish.
title: Sparkman 2009 Wilderness Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aged in large oak casks, this gorgeous Pinot Bianco shows lively aromas of white flower, pear, Golden Delicious apple and stone fruit. It's a tight, well-compacted wine, with enormous length and elegance on the finish.
title: St. Pauls 2008 Passion Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

description: A Bordeaux-style blend of Cabernet, Malbec and Merlot, this bright and grapy effort pleasingly integrates slightly rougher notes of earth, leaf and stem. It all works here, adding texture and detail to the tart berry fruits. Drink in the next 3–5 years.
title: Adamant Cellars 2008 Nalin Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This young wine brims with fresh acidity and primary cherry, blackberry and cola flavors. The complexity is considerable and so is the elegance. It feels graceful and silky in the mouth, despite the power of the fruit. Should hit its peak in two or three years.
title: Ampelos 2010 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This hearty blend boasts a dark, inky color, with bright aromas of black fruit, cola, dried rosemary, black olive and spice. The finish is thick, concentrated and long lasting.
title: Argiolas 2005 Turriga Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: An eccentric Chardonnay, with botrytis-like flavors of apricot jam and honey dominating, but there also are rich notes of buttered toast and tropical fruit. It's dry and creamy and a little warm. Drink over the next 3 years.
