title: Andrew Murray 2014 Enchante Curtis Vineyard White (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Aged both in French oak and stainless steel, this entry-level white is creamy in texture with a taste of lemon cream pie and vanilla swirls, the tannins tight and the oak present, though cradling. Fresh and fruity, this is a food-friendly, approachable wine.
title: Artesa 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Attractive aromas of rose, plum and blue flower float out of the glass. On the palate, vanilla, espresso and toasted oak overwhelm dried black cherry while astringent tannins leave a mouth-drying finish.
title: Mario Gagliasso 2011 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)

description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of dried black cherry and toasted notes. On the concentrated palate, oak-driven spice takes center stage while mature dark-skinned fruit and dried prune provide the background. Pair it with Gorgonzola at the end of the meal.
title: Monte Faustino 2011  Recioto della Valpolicella Classico

description: Made entirely with Garganega, this offers aromas of maple syrup, pressed white flower and candied orange zest. The round palate doles out dried apricot and tangerine while a hint of orange blossom honey backs up the finish.
title: Suavia 2009 Acinatium  (Recioto di Soave)

description: This is a soft, well-integrated wine with a full-throttle backbone of cedar and cranberry that drinks easily and is ready for the table. Priced attractively, it offers value for the quality and broad appeal.
title: Bench 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: This is the producer's first barrel-aged Chardonnay, made from a blend of two vineyards and two clones, including one from their own estate on Westside Road. Sour and sweet alternatively, it finds a steely path to balance and soft layers of apple, Asian pear and a touch of ginger-topped butterscotch.
title: Bucher 2014 Rio Oro Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A severity of tannin and heat opens this wine before mellowing into soft, juicy red raspberry and plum. Remaining relatively light bodied and restrained for the variety, it becomes softer on the chocolaty midpalate before a grippy finish grabs back the power.
title: Byington 2013 Smith Vineyards Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Aromas of pressed Spanish broom, oak, marzipan and citrus blend in the glass. The rich, medium-bodied palate offers candied nectarine zest, vanilla and toasted almond alongside bright acidity. Drink now or hold for a few more years.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
title: Casalfarneto 2012 Crisio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)

description: A warm blend mainly of Grenache with Carignan and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is typically pale in color, with just a touch of tannin from the Cabernet. A spicy undertone balances with the deliciously crisp and fresh red-fruit character.
title: Château de Beaupré 2015 Baron Maxime Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This blend of Rolle and Ugni Blanc, typical of Provence whites, is smooth, ripe and only lightly textured. The Rolle (Vermentino) that dominates gives an attractive perfumed character as well as a mineral texture and acidity. Drink now.
title: Château d'Ollières 2015 Prestige White (Coteaux Varois)

description: With its floral rose motif, the bottle is attractive in itself. The rosé inside comes to life with crisp red fruits and lively acidity. This wine has a real freshness with a tangy texture, spice and a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Roubine 2015 La Vie en Rose Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a delicious, perfumed and fruity wine. It is crisp and clean, bright with acidity and ripe in raspberry flavors. This wine is a perfect summer quaffing rosé.
title: Château Valcolombe 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This attractive, citrus-driven blend of Vermentino and Sauvignon Blanc comes from an estate created by the Knights Templar in the 13th century. It owes a lot to the Sauvignon in its tight herbal character. Lemon and grapefruit fruits are filled out with more exotic pineapple and mango flavors. The wine is a little young to drink now so try waiting until late 2016.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2015 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This rich, full-bodied wine has ripe green and white fruits along with a touch of minerality. It is a sophisticated wine that adds acidity to its complex array of flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Confidence 2015 Indiscreet Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This vibrant white opens with delicate scents of white flower and tree fruit. The zesty palate offers lime, Bartlett pear and a hint of white grapefruit alongside racy acidity. A note of bitter almond backs up the finish.
title: Cornarea 2014  Roero

description: A robust, full-bodied expression of earth and forest mark this well-made wine, a touch of spearmint surrounding red and black cherry.
title: Davis Estates 2013 Ravishing Raven Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Owned by the Quiot family of Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this is one of a pair of wines produced from the region of Sainte-Victoire. It is a full and fruity wine, rich with raspberries and freshened by final grapefruit acidity.
title: Domaine Houchart 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bunan's 18th-century castle is called Belle Raisin—Bélouvé in the old Provençal dialect (beautiful grapes in English). With a range of varieties in the blend, it is an attractively integrated wine that has red cherry, raspberry and crisp apple flavors. It is lively and full of ripe fruits, with just a touch of pepper at the end.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Bélouvé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The aromas bring generous notes of botrytis, chamomile, flowers, peach, ale and green apple. It drinks off dry, with well-balanced stone fruit and floral flavors that linger.
title: Dunham 2014 Lewis Estate Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tart, acidic red fruit—pomegranate, sour raspberry—is given some sweet spice and sandalwood from barrel aging. The all-too-typical earthy/herbal aromas that plague so many Oregon Pinots are out in force. The wine sits in the mouth, sour and tight, without enough weight or texture to hint at future pleasure.
title: Dobbes Family Estate 2005 Meyer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Citrus blossom, apricot, peach, minerals and white peppercorn emerge from the nose of this attractively priced Chard. It boasts medium build and persistency with nice acidity and a spice-filled finish.
title: Farnese 2006 Farneto Valley Chardonnay (Terre di Chieti)

description: Soft and honeyed, with vanilla-tinged flavors of all sorts of tropical fruits that finish with a spicy hit of butterscotch. A blend of Chardonnay, Muscat and Chenin Blanc.
designation: Ménage à Trois White Table Wine
title: Folie à Deux 2006 Ménage à Trois White Table Wine White (California)

description: This is a new wine from the Lurton brothers, and it's got good weight, color and integrity. It also shows a lot of hickory and pickle from the oak and some wayward vanilla on the juicy, jumpy palate. Not a refined wine but pretty good for size and zip.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2006 Hacienda Araucano Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: Bright and colorful, somewhere between a salmon pink and a light copper, this fresh rosé tastes of strawberries and wild raspberries. The finish is lightly spicy and showing just a hint of milk chocolate.
title: Ponzi 2006 Rosato Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: You might not know it from the name, but this is a bit of a critter wine, as Bulldozer is a nickname for the hairy-nosed wombat. In any event, it's a step up from much of the competition, offering sturdy cassis flavors tinged with pepper and herbs and a clean, mouthwatering finish. Imported by MHW, Ltd.
title: Nelwood Wines 2004 Nelwood Station Bulldozer Red (South Australia)

description: This Grechetto-based wine has a pretty straw appearance and definitely puts an emphasis on nuts, melon and stone fruit. Thanks to a smooth mouthfeel and spicy finish, it does liven up in the mouth.
title: Sergio Mottura 2005 Poggio della Costa  (Civitella d'Agliano)

description: Spicy, fruity and nicely rounded, this wine boasts great flavor intensity without the sharp points sometimes associated with Montepulciano. It's an easy, approachable wine perfect for everyday dining with solid tannins and good length.
title: Masciarelli 2003  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo

description: If you are not familiar with the hearty Montepulciano grape variety from central Italy but adore modern, structured, New World reds, you should considered adding this wine to your weekly shopping list. Thick in power, extracts and color, Montepulciano has rock-solid tannins and blockbuster aromas of blackberry, prune, chocolate, spice and toast that appear naturally, even without wood aging. This is a big value wine that should pair with a big value meal of barbecued baby back ribs in smoked sauce and spicy potato salad.
title: Masciarelli 2005 Valori  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Smoky cola and plum flavors feature some intriguingly briary notes, but also veer toward prune and cooked fruit. Tannins are soft, but the wine is surprisingly tart on the finish. With its crisp acidity, expect it to pair well with tomato-based sauces.
title: Masseria Altemura 2005 Sasseo Primitivo (Salento)

description: Honeysuckle scents and flavors of pear, papaya and cucumber lead into a fresh and delicate wine, with plenty of acid behind the crisp fruit.
title: Gypsy Dancer 2006 Christine Lorraine Vineyard Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Here's a solid value that shows true Napa style. Dry and balanced, it offers up rich flavors of cherries, blackberries and spice, wrapped into smooth tannins.
title: Leaping Lizard 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Early aromas are earthy, sort of like coffee grinds mixed with baked fruit. The palate hits with a dose of creamy milk chocolate, while later on berries and vanilla rise up. More of a plump, sweet and unctuous wine made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Imported by North Lake Wines.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2004 Escudo Rojo Red (Maipo Valley)

description: Two native Sicilian grapes—Catarratto and Inzolia—are blended here to produce an easy, well-priced drinking wine with fresh aromas of citrus, peach and stone fruit. The wine is light in color and consistency and would make an excellent informal luncheon companion.
title: Capocroce 2005 Sapìri White (Sicilia)

description: A little simple in citrus flavor, but for the price, a pretty nice wine. It's the kind of crisp, dry white I've had many times at gallery openings and such, inexpensive, but with enough panache to satisfy a picky crowd.
title: Robert Mondavi 2006 Private Selection Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Dusty applesauce aromas lead to a pulpy, medium-bodied palate in this pure Xarello. It tastes of bitter grape skins , papaya and green melon, its tropical notes offset by grassy and briny hints on the finish.
title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Pansa Blanca (Alella)

description: This yellow-looking Chardonnay smells briny and like oily popcorn. The palate is both watery in feel and resiny. Nutty, salty flavors of popcorn crowd out apple notes, while the finish is dilute.
title: Ritual 2015 Supertuga Block Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Made entirely with the native grape Bombino Nero, this informal light-bodied wine has subdued aromas of wild cherry and a hint of crushed herb. The aromas carry over to the über-simple palate along with a hint of pink grapefruit.
title: Rivera 2016 Rosé (Castel del Monte)

description: This wine is reduced and somewhat flat in tone, with simple, light-bodied ripeness and plum and raspberry flavors.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Two Range Red (Napa Valley)

description: This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is rustic with some hard tannins and intense acidity. Since it is still young, the wine could soften but it seems to be more about its structure than its fruit.
title: Santos & Santos 2015 Quinta da Cidadoura Red (Lisboa)

description: As peppery as a jalapeño, with persistent spiciness, this wine offers high-octane ripeness and a healthy cradling of oak, finishing with a touch of heat.
title: The Federalist 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Earthy mossy spicy aromas are the high point on this edgy rubbery amped-up Carmenère. This is blocky and chunky on the palate, with blueberry and leathery flavors. Lively but rough feeling on a peppery, herbal finish.
title: Viña La Fortuna 2013 Twelvestone Carmenère (Lontué Valley)

description: The white wines in the Wine By Joe portfolio are fresh, well-made and offer exceptional value. It's tougher to do with Oregon Pinot Noir. This thin, disjointed and simple wine has aggressive vegetal character and unappealing earthiness.
title: Wine by Joe 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Aromas of animal hide, rubber and herbal berry fruits are not lovable. This has a heavy scratchy mouthfeel and lightly green flavors of berry fruits mixed with unabsorbed oak. This tastes toasty and blackened on an abrasive finish.
title: Santa Rita 2015 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: In this Verdosilla, an obscure white variety from the Valencia region, yeasty, bready aromas are mild and slightly floral. Its palate is watery and not very crisp, with dry apricot flavors that have no zing.
title: Ostras Pedrin 2016 Verdosilla (Valencia)

description: This flat, watery wine has yeasty, generic stone fruit flavors and salty, bitter grape skin flavors. It's round in mouthfeel but inexact on the finish.
title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Brunus Rosé (Montsant)

description: Bland apple and citrus aromas are oaky, with a note of popcorn. This feels plump and short on core acidity. Melon, applesauce and oak-resin flavors finish flat and with a flavor note of fresh butter.
title: Santa Carolina 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)

description: Aromas of orange blossom and wild berry lead the way. The bright simple palate is on the slender side, offering suggestions of strawberry and cherry alongside vibrant acidity.
title: Santi 2016 Infinito  (Bardolino Chiaretto)

description: There is plenty of juicy acidity in this wine even though the fruit has a strangely steely character. The tannins give it a firm character that needs to soften.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva
title: Santos & Santos 2013 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Gamay and Prokupe has aromas of tart cherry and Mediterranean herbs. Flavors recall cherry, black plum and stewed prune.
title: Stone Castle 2014 Amphora Red

description: This wine has aromas of honeysuckle and lemon curd, with flavors of lemon-meringue pie and lemon pith. The finish is clean and crisp.
title: Stone Castle 2015 Royal Riesling

description: A tan color and dusty, tired aromas put this Chardonnay on short notice. Its plump palate delivers a mix of stone fruit and bitter, skin-based flavors, with a static finish.
title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Chardonnay Chardonnay (Valencia)

description: The Encruzado and Malvasia blend is both fruity and intensely perfumed. It has a touch of lychee as well as crisper grapefruit. Drink the wine starting now.
title: Vinihold 2016 Altimo Branco White (Dão)

description: Applesauce and woody aromas don't offend but they aren't anything special or enticing. This feels chunky and fairly flat. Woody resiny flavors are low to empty on fruit, while this tastes yeasty on the finish.
title: Las Niñas 2015 Reserva Chardonnay (Apalta)

description: This wine's neutral nose includes mild citrus scents. It's tired and bland on the palate, with yeasty flavors, finishing with papaya and commercial white bread notes.
title: Marques de Toledo 2015 Verdejo (La Mancha)

description: Charred resiny oak aromas dominate herbal berry fruit. This is rough and raw on the palate, with sizzling tartaric acidity and forceful tannins. Flavors of burnt black coffee and herbal plum finish with a ring of excess acidity.
title: TerraNoble 2013 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: There is no compromise in the pinkness of the color of this wine. It is fruity with plenty of acidity and with a touch of caramel as well as some light tannins. Drink this blend of Syrah and Aragonez now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Rosé (Alentejo)

description: This simple rosato has subdued aromas suggesting red berry and a whiff of wild flower. The light informal palate evokes sour cherry and orange zest alongside tangy acidity.
title: Cantine Ermes 2016 Marchese Montefusco Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

description: This Garnacha-Carignan blend contains some Syrah as well and smells almost exclusively of clove and spice. On the palate, it's resiny and sticky, with overwrought clove and barrel spice flavors that dominate the finish.
title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Red (Montsant)

description: A light and bright wine, this offers plenty of herbal fruit that is lifted by crisp acidity. The wine is refreshing, lively and ready to drink.
title: Château Haut Mondain 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This candy-pink-colored wine offers candy-pink-colored flavors. It conveys caramel as much as fruit, although with acidity and a tangy aftertaste.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This medium-bodied rosé has aromas of strawberries and rose petals, and flavors of cherry, strawberry and tart cherry. The finish is clean, with a slight touch of residual sweetness on the palate.
title: Côtnar Hills 2014 Semi-Dry Rosé (Ukraine)

description: This wine is on the sweet side of crisp, with ripe strawberry and plenty of acidity. It is a wine to chill, with its bright aftertaste and slight prickle on the tongue. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2016 Mapreco Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Verdejo is light in body, with stalky haystack aromas and dilute nectarine and melon flavors. Its yeasty finish is somewhat bland.
title: Viña San Juan 2015 White (La Mancha)

description: Lime and orange aromas smell more like a household cleanser than honest fruit. A chunky palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of yeast and white bread more than fruit. Bitterness on the finish transitions to yeasty as this fades.
title: Cuyen 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: This wine is spicy, fruity and packed with herbal and lemon flavors. It will soon be a refreshing wine, lively and with swathes of acidity. Drink from late summer 2017.
title: Château de Bonhoste 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a warm wine, ripe and with hints of yellow fruits as well as crisper acidity. Poised between herbal and riper flavors, it's ready to drink now.
title: Château La Rame 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine from Maison Ginestet is all crisp, green fruit. Light and bright, it bursts with acidity and perfumed fruitiness. Drink now.
designation: Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion Blanc
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2016 Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Light and bright, this is a perfumed wine. Its very present acidity is underpinned by spice, red-currant fruits and a tangy, tangerine aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pascal Sirat named this wine for his father and his son. Bright and fruity, it is already deliciously light, refreshing and bright. Acidity jumps out of the glass, giving a crisp, fresh character. The aftertaste is more taut and tense. Drink now.
title: Château Panchille 2016 Blanc de Fernand  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: From vineyards on the slope above Cadillac, this is a tight, mineral-textured wine. With crisp lemon flavors, it is brightly lit with acidity and clean fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Suau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Fresh earthy notes join the subtle peach fruit on the nose. The palate counters with slightly bitter notes that seem slightly out of joint. Drink this while aromas are fresh.
title: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Glintzberg Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: This ripe fruity wine is bursting with young red fruits. It has a fine structure that gives a core of dryness. It also has a crisp edge that brings out the fruit and the liveliness of this attractive wine. Ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Sauvat 2016 Demoiselles Gamay

description: Iron-laced beef aromas meet boysenberry and wet stone on the nose of this widely available and smartly priced wine from the historic producer. Red cherry fruit shows on the palate along with a touch of turned earth, making for a pleasant yet simple sip.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Merlot (Central Coast)

description: This mild, plump and basic Chardonnay leads with peach blossom, yeast and cured ham scents. Its melon, peach and apricot flavors hollow out on a mild, yeasty tasting finish.
title: Enate 2016 234 Chardonnay (Somontano)

description: The floral aromas in this animated wine give way to fragrant fruit salad flavors that range from orange to pineapple to apple. It has a nicely tart texture and lingering fruity finish.
title: Enotria 2014 Uvaggio Isabella Arneis (Mendocino County)

description: Not quite as bold as its name suggests, this wine is well-balanced and fun to sip. Fruity and medium-bodied, it smells like raspberries and rhubarb, tastes like red cherries and feels nicely full on the palate, bolstered by a hearty dose of fine tannins.
title: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California)

description: With its delicate onion-peel color and rather subdued aromas, this rosato appears older than it is. The palate is a bit more expressive and slightly fresher, offering suggestions of tart apple and sour cherry before finishing on a bitter note.
title: Feudo Maccari 2016 Rosé (Terre Siciliane)

description: Butterscotch, lemon peel and a faint flinty quality show on the nose of this bottling from the Chalone team. Tangy mandarin flavors meet almond butter, honeysuckle and gunmetal touches on the palate.
title: Gavilan 2014 Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: The wine brings out a strongly herbal, tangy character in this perfumed grape. With spice and intense acidity, the wine is still young, still with a closed character. This needs to be drunk from late 2017 or even 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 V Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and sweet blackberry jam and dried fig flavors fill out this Port-style sweet wine. Good doses of tannin and acidity keep it structured enough to not feel cloying, lending a little textural grip.
title: Casto Oaks 2014 Syrah Port (Sierra Foothills)

description: A light fragrant blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Cão, the wine is soft with plenty of strawberry fruitiness and acidity. The aftertaste has a great lift of perfumed crispness.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezirias Tyto Alba Rosé (Tejo)

description: The aromas in this wine are light, with notes of herb, citrus and orange peel. The palate is dry and broad, with tart citrus flavors. Although appealing, it seems a bit generic.
title: Zero One Vintners 2015 Copper Lily Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of oak, underbrush and a whiff of wet stone lift out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the lean palate along with ripe yellow-apple skin, a hint of citrus zest and a saline note. It closes on a bitter nutty note.
title: Assuli 2015 Astolfo Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

description: Berry and plum aromas are creamy and spicy while hinting at prune. This everyday Cabernet feels creamy and a touch flat and soupy. Plum and berry flavors are slightly weedy, while this holds steady on a chunky finish.
title: Root:1 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: This is a stiff, tannic wine with wood smoke and tart cherry flavors and a firm, mouth-puckering texture that persists on the finish. It leads with a lush blackberry jam aroma but then closes in and tightens up.
title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2014 Father's Watch Red (North Coast)

description: In a ripe Bordeaux year, Sauvignon Blanc goes towards tropical and yellow fruits, making it ripe while also light and crisp. This refreshing, rounded wine is ready to drink.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château les Jouberts Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This pale pink to slightly orange rosé shows tangerine, cantaloupe, cherry and sand aromas on the somewhat muddled nose. It's light in texture and a little flat on the palate but presents enjoyable squeezed lemon and watermelon flavors.
title: Mariposa 2016 Rosé (Central Coast)

description: This is made from a majority of Petit Verdot with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Dusty sage and raspberry notes form waves of big flavor and tannin, the fruit modest.
title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Midnight Red (Oak Knoll District)

description: Toast, Bosc pear, spice, lees and flower aromas are followed by a sleekly styled palate. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
title: Noviello 2015 French Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: Bold yellow-gold in color, this aged, barrel-fermented Verdejo has predictably heavy aromas of wood spice and resin, joined by hints of carrot juice and apricot. It has solid palate with adequate acidity, showing oaky stone fruit flavors that finish with a heavy dose of barrel spice.
title: Pradorey 2011 PR3 Barricas Verdejo (Rueda)

description: Half-and-half Alvarinho and Trajadura, the wine is dry, crisp and with just a touch of fizz. Grapefruit and lemon flavors mingle with softer apples to give a bright and lively wine that is just made for summer food. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Aromas das Castas Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This blend, with 50% Touriga Nacional, is deliciously crisp while also ripe. It has a softly tannic texture that gives it a zesty character. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Quinta dos Murças 2016 Assobio Rosé (Douro)

description: Pear drop and strawberry make for a fresh inviting nose. The palate is slightly dilute but very fresh and lively with some residual carbon dioxide. This is light and dry. Drink while aromas are fresh.
title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Alsace)

description: This attractively crisp wine packed with red berry fruits is light and lively. It offers plenty of acidity along with a touch of pepper and cinnamon. Drink now.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Subdued aromas of plum and a hint of violet lead the way. The easy-drinking, straightforward palate conveys black cherry, pomegranate and a hint of anise alongside soft, fleeting tannins.
title: Principe di Corleone 2014 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: This straightforward, refreshing wine offers subdued, short-lived aromas of small red berry and a whiff of cake spice. The bright, simple palate doles out strawberry, raspberry and a hint of ginger alongside lively acidity.
title: Spadafora 2014 Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

description: Pleasing aromas of a warm croissant mix with sharper hibiscus, rose petals, cola and strawberry on the nose of this wine. The palate shows rose petals and tart raspberry fruit, then gives way to more bitter elements of tar and sour cherries.
title: White Hart Wine 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine is flavorful and sturdy. Full bodied enough to accompany rich dishes, it's affordable, too. It has butter and caramel aromas, an almost thick, syrupy texture and firm tannins. Moderate cherry flavors accompany the oaky components.
title: Bonterra 2014 Made With Organic Grapes Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: This ripe and fruity wine has an edge of tannins to give it structure. It's full of juicy black fruits, rich berry flavors and fresh acidity. The wine will age as the tannins round out further, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Fortin Plaisance 2012  Saint-Émilion

description: This is a stalky wine, full of black-currant fruits and with just enough weight to balance tannins and the dry structure. It has the potential to become an attractive, fruity wine, so drink from 2018.
title: Château Grivière 2013  Médoc

description: This stalky and fruity wine has fresh red-currant flavors that are backed up by dry tannins. It is a light wine, as much fruit as texture, and is likely to age quickly. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Hauchat 2013  Fronsac

description: From vineyards in the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux, this Fontana family wine has a dry core surrounded by ripe, fresh fruit. It is still young and should age, certainly until 2017.
title: Château Haut Clairbes 2014 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux)

description: Soft and fresh, this fruity wine comes from sandy soil that gives it lightness, especially in this vintage. Fresh fruits and soft tannins make this wine ready to drink now.
title: Château la Croix du Casse 2013  Pomerol

description: With 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, this is an unusual blend for a Haut-Médoc wine. The result is a wine that's light and already soft. Fresh red-berry flavors are lightly underlined by tannins. It will develop fast, so drink from 2017.
title: Château Reysson 2013  Haut-Médoc

description: The fig, licorice and spice aromas seem somewhat dried out and tired. The cherry and cranberry flavors are smooth, with the tannins showing some grit. Drink now.
title: Chateau Rollat 2011 Rollat Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Pithy aromas of melon and apple are low in oak and emphasize minerality. This feels full and chunky, but also acidic. Briny flavors of stone fruits lean toward sour, while an oily, briny tasting finish is short on elegance.
designation: Single Vineyard Block no.5 Quebrada Alta
title: Cono Sur 2014 Single Vineyard Block no.5 Quebrada Alta Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: This wine has the alcohol of the vintage along with the tannins and some of the juicy black-currant fruitiness. Lightly perfumed, it's still dry with its firm texture. It will develop although it is ready to drink.
title: Château de l'Abbaye de Saint-Ferme 2010  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine is firm and structured, on the dry side with more sinews than flesh. That tough, stalky edge to the wine will remain always.
title: Château Haut Nouchet 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: It's a shame that the producer used too much wood in this difficult vintage. The fruit is delicate, with the black-currant flavors and acidity smothered by a burnt, toasty character that's hard to taste through. It will soften, although the wood will always be there. Vignobles Roux bought this Cru Bourgeois in 2013. The blend is 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taffard de Blaignan 2013 Cru Bourgeois  (Médoc)

description: This wine shows unusually prominent aromas and flavors of dried rice that are followed by wilted flowers, dried leaves, cocoa and dark fruit. It doesn't all come together.
title: Columbia Crest 2013 Reserve Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This wine comes in with a low, unheard-of (in Washington) 12.2% alcohol. The aromas offer reticent and unusual notes of wheat, lemongrass, tobacco, vanilla and herbs while the flavors are tart and supple. It doesn't seem outright underripe but comes off as faint.
title: Cougar Crest 2012 Estate Grown Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: With a mix of graham cracker, coffee, herb and jammy, unfocused berry aromas, this lacks cohesion on the nose. A fat, wide palate offers no point of focus, while herbal flavors of cassis and olive finish with green notes of tobacco and oregano.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2013 Riscos de Puquillay Alto Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: Chunky, meaty, saucy plum and berry aromas are green and gritty. This is solid feeling on first blush, but then it collapses and turns clampy and tannic. Minimal berry and cassis flavors battle with herbal, green notes in front of a chubby, imprecise finish.
title: Siegel 2013 Special Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: This opens with unusual aromas of celery, medicinal herb, saline and a vegetal note with the barest whisper of dark fruit in the background. The unusual medicinal aromas carry over to the palate along with a hint of candied cherry and menthol before finishing abruptly, leaving a bitter aftertaste.
title: FiàNobile 2013 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: Some oxygen exposure seems to peek through on the aromas along with notes of blue fruit and herbs. This wine is lightly flavored with a gritty feel to the tannins and the oak dialed back.
title: Wilridge 2013 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine has a lighter-than-usual color, fresh aromas like cucumbers and jicama, and clean, straightforward apple flavors backed by good, crisp acidity. It's simply good and refreshing.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2014 Chardonnay (California)

description: Peach pit, matchstick and almond skin aromas come across a bit harsh. This is chunky on the palate, with pulpy, pithy melon and lees flavors that take on a briny characteristic on the finish.
title: Rubus 2014 Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Aromas of vanilla and pear are mild on the nose. This feels heavy and chunky, with low acidity. Vanilla, melon and papaya flavors taste as though they're on the way out, while this soft Chardonnay feels oily on the finish.
title: Santa Carolina 2013 Reserva de Familia Chardonnay (Limarí Valley)

description: Barrel aromas of vanilla and woodspice are out front and lead to light, elegant fruit and barrel flavors that vie for attention through the finish.
title: Seven Falls 2014 Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)

description: Earthy, scratchy, herbal aromas of cassis and raspberry lead to a punchy, wiry palate. Generic cherry and berry flavors are herbal and lightly green, while this is grabby and tannic on the finish.
title: Albamar 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)

description: Produced in the Entre-deux-Mers region, this light, fresh wine has young tannins and stalky black-currant flavors. It is crisp with lively acidity and a juicy aftertaste. Give it another few months and drink from late 2016.
title: Château Blouin 2014  Bordeaux

description: Still not in balance, this wine shows blackberry flavors and acidity pushed up against dark, lean tannins. It may fill out although that is not certain. The Castaing family has farmed crops and grazing animals since 1800s. The 13-acre vineyard, 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Merlot, was added in 1995.
title: Château Jaulien 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This light wine has red berry flavors and lots of acidity. With only the lightest texture, it's all about fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château Lapinesse 2013 Les Terrasses de Colas  (Graves)

description: This wine has the ripe fruitiness of the vintage, fresh and crisp although with a rich background of apple and pear flavors. Not aged in wood, the wine is all fruit with lively final acidity.
title: Château Lapinesse 2014  Graves

description: A nice Russian River Chard, firm in acidic minerals, with an edge of dried herbs and wood char to the pineapple, green apple and cream caramel flavors.
title: De Loach 2006 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Bordeaux blend is full-bodied and ripe in blackberry, cherry, currant and cola flavors, with smoky, oaky notes. Tasted in the winter of 2008, it had a dry, tannic astringency that suggested pairing with rich, marbled meats. Should develop in the bottle through 2012.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2004 Rhinefarm Vineyard Mountain Cuvée Red (Sonoma Valley)

description: Fruity, immediately appealing berry flavors dominate this wine. It has an edge of wood, but that simply smoothes out the fruit rather than adding tannins. Lively, delicious, drinkable now.
title: Hans Igler 2005 Ried Hochberg Blaufränkisch (Mittelburgenland)

description: From the Villamont domaine, this is a soft, rounded, quite generous wine that is dominated by enjoyable bright red fruits. It's fresh, ripe, just lightly touched by tannins, and with a juicy, friendly aftertaste.
title: Henri de Villamont 2005 Le Village  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: There is some good depth of flavor to this wine, the strawberry flavors going right through until they meet the tannic core. The acidity balances well, pushing the fruit through the dryness, leaving freshness and juicy fruits.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2005 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A multiple vineyard blend, this includes 10% Merlot, which seems to open up the middle a bit. The fruit is generous and sweet, a mix of berries and cherries and plums, with a streak of coffee running through it. There is a high-toned spicy quality to the aromas, just a hint of volatility, but well-managed.
title: Camaraderie 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: This is classic Washington Merlot, with flesh and a full-bodied middle. It offers a generous palate of cherries and berries, trailing into light tannins with a streak of green tea and coffee. The wine is balanced and bright, with lightly lifted aromas and a solid midpalate.
title: Camaraderie 2003 Merlot (Washington)

description: An elegant, memorable wine with balance and poise. The nose offers red berry, warming spice and a touch of smoke, while on the palate, smooth, dark berry and spice flavors are harmonious and rich. The wine can age but is good now. Pair with a succulent duck dish or pate and cheeses.
designation: Villa Zorilor Prince Matei Gran Riserva
title: VinArte 2002 Villa Zorilor Prince Matei Gran Riserva Merlot (Dealu Mare)

description: This has been 10% barrel fermented and aged for about two months. There's a hint of barrel toast but it's very light; the varietal character is nicely displayed. Crisp acidity and a strong citrus mix of orange blossom and lemon rind flavors define the midpalate, leading into pineapple and grapefruit as it winds through the finish. Nice bottle!
title: Whitman Cellars 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pretty straightforward Cabernet, done well and blended with bits of Petit Verdot and Merlot. Vanilla, tobacco and cassis aromas mark the nose, while the flavors are similar, but with a slightly plummy edge. Soft and supple on the finish, there's no need to cellar this wine.
title: Wente 2005 Charles Wetmore Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

description: The winemaking has a slightly Australian flavor, aging primarily in American oak and going into barrel while still fermenting, resulting in a fairly soft wine with good intensity and varietal character. Some slightly smoky, earthy notes and cured meat aromas give way to blackberry and cola flavors on the palate, finishing up with a hint of coffee. Drink now–2015.
title: Wente 2005 The Nth Degree Syrah (Livermore Valley)

description: Trapiche's Broquel is definitely one of Argentina's most consistent Bonardas. It opens with balsamic notes that accent chocolate and blackberry aromas, while the palate is sweet and steady as it delivers plum and ripe berry flavors. Good structure and feel, with just enough acidity to keep it in balance.
title: Trapiche 2006 Broquel Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: This single-vineyard Agiorgitiko has an earthy olive nose and smooth, integrated flavors of red berry, herbs and spice. Soft but structured tannins and a spin of spice on the finish recommend it for heartier dishes, but it's good enough to savor on its own. Elegant, but with some muscle.
title: Papaioannou 2003 Old Vines Single Vineyard Agiorgitiko (Nemea)

description: The aromas of sarsparilla, tree bark, dried raspberry and cumin take you back to traditional Rioja winemaking. With lighter-weight fruit, herb and tomato leaf flavors, this is a solid old-school wine that will hit the right marks with tapas or roast meats. It's got some tea and tang as well, courtesy of zesty acids.
title: Baron De Ley 1998 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Sweet and fragrant, floral and fruity, this Prosecco Extra Dry (with 10% Pinot Bianco) has a feminine, creamy disposition and excellent harmony of aromas and effervescence. It's very filling in the mouth with generous accents of stone fruit and honey; “47” marks the year the winery was founded.
title: Bortolotti NV Extra Dry 47  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: This medium-bodied Shiraz features plenty of spicy complexity and creamy-soft tannins, making it ideal for current consumption. Cedar, vanilla and spice accent raspberry fruit and linger elegantly on the finish.
title: Celestial Bay 2004 Shiraz (Margaret River)

description: A good, rich Merlot-based Bordeaux blend. Its ripe, almost decadent red and black currant and carob flavors are balanced with an herbal earthiness and soft, fine tannins.
title: Clos La Chance 2005 Crimson Topaz Meritage (Central Coast)

description: This is a tonic and fresh Prosecco Brut with pretty aromas of peach and pear backed by fragrant lemon, orange blossom and a tiny touch of chopped basil. The nose is extremely polished and pure with a very attractive mineral dimension.
title: Col Vetoraz Spumanti NV Brut  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: Sharp, minty-peppery and tannicly dry in its youth, this Syrah is rich enough in fruit to warrant some years in the cellar. That could give it time to soften and let the ripe blackberry, chocolate, coffee and gingersnap cookie flavors out. Try 2009–2011.
title: Petroni 2005 Estate Syrah (Sonoma Valley)

description: The Pittnauers make something of a specialty of the St Laurent grape, and their success is reflected in this vivid, fruity, juicy wine, an Austrian Beaujolais, all freshness and blackberry fruits topped with acidity. Screwcap.
title: Pittnauer 2006 Sankt Laurent St. Laurent (Burgenland)

description: Nearly dry in style, this wine starts off with primary fruit aromas of ripe apples, slightly underripe peaches and a touch of grapefruit, then delivers stonier, more minerally flavors on the palate. Imported by Chapin Cellars, LLC.
title: Rudolf Eilenz 2006 Ayler Kupp Spätlese Feinherb Riesling (Mosel-Saar-Ruwer)

description: Karl Steininger's winery forms part of the new Loisium complex of wine exhibition and hotel in Langenlois, designed by New York architect Steven Holl (commemorated on the label). This wine comes from the adjacent vineyard. It's a full, rich style, rounded, with creamy apple flavors, touched by white currant acidity. Glass stopper.
title: Steininger 2007 Loisiumweingarten Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)

description: From one of the good value communes at the northern end of the Côte de Beaune, this Chorey is soft, juicy with strawberry flavors and framed by tannins. The acidity is there, but the effect is of a ripe, easy wine, ready to drink now.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2005  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: Densely tannic and firm, this wine has fresh acidity and red-plum-skin flavors. It is a solid, chunky wine, likely to age well, with a vibrant, juicy freshness in the aftertaste.
title: Louis Latour 2005  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Powerful, ripe wine, plump and structured. There are fresh black cherries and plums and structure that promises some aging.
title: Corton André 2005  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Floral and aromatic, this wine is the opposite of the typical tannic Nuits-St.-Georges. It is lively, with vibrant red fruits, great rich black cherry flavors, with a light layer of tannin providing structure.
title: Corton André 2005 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Cavit is an important wine cooperative in northern Italy that is largely responsible for Pinot Grigio's immense popularity in the United States. This bottle shows easy tones of peach and citrus.
title: Cavit 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: Flavors of pear and white peach drive this clean, fruity wine. It has a tang of citrus and acidity that adds a lively edge. Ready to drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 Chaminé Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Light, bright and fruity, this has soft tannins, plenty of red fruits and balancing acidity. Just dry to finish, it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2010 Le Renard  (Givry)

description: Dry and tonic, this has steely bubbles and subtle aromas of crushed stone, citrus and dry hay. Pair this easy with fried finger foods or grilled shrimp appetizers.
title: Riondo 2010 Punto Rosso Brut  (Prosecco)

description: Foamy bubbles and lively aromas of citrus, peach and Golden Delicious apple mark this sparkler. It's “frizzante,” which means the effervescence is soft and creamy.
title: Riondo NV Spago Nero  (Prosecco)

description: Simply constructed, this has flavors of orange, mango and buttered toast. This will appeal to many who like their white wines with some sweetness.
title: Jade Mountain 2009 White (California)

description: This easy-going Prosecco opens with a fresh bouquet of white flowers, citrus, peach and talc powder. The mouthfeel is crisp, fresh and very informal.
title: Trevisana NV Santiquaranta Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

description: This is a bit thin on the palate, with flavors of sour black-cherry candy and spice. It earns a few extra points for its elegance and fine tannins.
title: Truchard 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carneros)

description: Black fruit and graphite aromas come with an earthy heaviness. This is intense, with driving tannins pushing the flavors of black plum and stewed meat. The finish is big and fruity, with a rubbery feel.
title: Andeluna 2010 Merlot (Tupungato)

description: This no-fuss wine is redolent of lemon soda, cut grass and bitter almond. The mouthfeel is clean and fresh.
title: Barone 2011 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: A solid everyday Pinot, this is dry, tart in acidity and silky in texture, with cranberry and pomegranate flavors.
title: Garnet 2010 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This has a silky texture, with weight and richness. Soft and ripe, this has a hint of spice that's attractively balanced by tangy acidity.
title: Henri Schoenheitz 2008 Herrenreben Riesling (Alsace)

description: Fresh, tart and crisp, this balances its natural acidity against sun-ripened aromas of peach and honeydew.
title: Villa Rubini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Bright and clean, this drinks easily thanks to its fresh aromas of citrus and stone fruit. The compact, crisp mouthfeel finishes with a touch of grated lemon zest.
title: Ruffino 2011 Lumina Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: The 8.3 designation refers to the residual sugar by weight. It is indeed a very sweet wine, rich in simple honey, orange and apricot flavors.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2010 Lafond Vineyard 8.3 Riesling (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This high-production Pinot shows good varietal flavors of red cherry candy, cola and spices. It feels common, with a simple finish.
title: A By Acacia 2010 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This unoaked Sauvignon Blanc showcases pure flavors of lemon, lime and green melon. The acidity is brisk, providing brightness. A touch of sugary sweetness on the finish should make it pair nicely with Asian fare.
title: Alma Sol 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

description: This is mellow up front, with mild aromas of melon and baby powder. It feels fresh and easygoing, with apple, citrus and vanilla flavors. Drink well chilled, and soon.
title: Alta Vista 2011 Classic Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: A Grenache blended with small amounts of Mourvèdre and Syrah, this may need more time in bottle to truly reveal itself. But for now, its herbal characteristics overpower the hidden notes of blueberry and vanilla trying to get out.
title: Andis 2010 Grenache (Amador County)

description: This is soft and smooth, with acidity and a creamy character. The flavors are reminiscent of ripe pear and spice. Very ready to drink.
title: Bott Frères 2010 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Easy and fresh, with a simple, crisp finish, this should pair with garden greens or sliced tomato and mozzarella
title: Caposaldo 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: Made in a style to appeal to many Chardonnay drinkers, this one seems to have sweetness, with flavors of custard, vanilla, butter cream and orange jam.
title: Churchill Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fairly round in the mouth, this has blackberry, vanilla and butter notes. It's rugged and simple, but tasty.
title: Real del Pedro 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This opens with huge aromas of dark berry, cola and maple. The palate is ultratannic and grabby, with a sandpaper mouthfeel and big, boistrous flavors of black fruit. Syrupy and tannic on the finish, it has an overt rugged feel.
title: Restivo 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Patagonia)

description: Bennett Valley is a cooler section of Sonoma County, and maybe the cool vintage was just too much. This wine isn't quite ripe.It's bone dry, acidic and tannic, and the fruit is herbal.
title: MacLaren 2009 Judge Family Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)

description: This California bottling of an Italian varietal is rustic, with flavors suggesting cherry pie filling. This should pair with burgers and similar fare.
title: Mosby 2008 Teroldego (Santa Barbara County)

description: This fruity wine is light in texture. It has gentle tannins, with bitterness and a stalky character that brings out the acidity.
title: Parras Vinhos 2009 Castelo do Sulco Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: Very simple and straightforward, this bright wine opens with aromas of lime, cut grass and white peach. It's crisp and lean on the finish.
title: Angelini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)

description: With a smoked char aftertaste, this wine is lacking in fruit and fairly simple. A weediness could be interpreted as cedar or dried herb, but teeter-totters on the borderline.
title: Kirkland Signature 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Gassy, bready apple aromas are dull and unfocused. This is flat in texture, with a low bubble bead. Flavors of yellow mustard, rhubarb and apple finish briny.
title: Torre Oria NV Brut Nature Vintage Sparkling (Cava)

description: From a certified organic, dry-farmed vineyard, this wine exudes an overabundance of rustic earth without finding a rightful companion in fruit, with just the merest hint of allspice underplayed on the finish.
title: Canihan 2012 Exuberance Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Stalky, leathery aromas deal only a modest amount of raspberry and plum scents. This Bobal-Cabernet Sauvignon blend is raw, lean and light in feel, with choppy, herbal cherry and currant flavors.
title: Castillo de Liria 2014 Winemaker's Selection Red (Valencia)

description: This old-vine wine shows signs of rotten fruit, certainly aromatically. On the palate, it is tight with dark tannins and a hard, extracted edge. It is hard to tell if it could soften. This property liess in both the Castillon and Franc appellations. Wine is vinified plot by plot.
title: Château Terrasson 2013 Cuvée Prevenche  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Yeasty, bland, unconvincing aromas make for an unremarkable opening. This is flabby and broken on the palate, with yeasty flavors of canned peas.
title: Falernia 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Elqui Valley)

description: This wine has too much extraction to allow the fruit to develop. It will soften out, although not enough. It is an 80% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon blend.
title: Château de Marsan 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: This wine has been too heavily extracted, giving a series of tough tannins and a hard edge without the fruit to balance things out. It is a blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25/25 Merlot and Cabernet Franc.
title: Château de Seguin 2013 La Vieille Cour de Seguin  (Bordeaux)

description: All dry tannin and bramble aromas, this wine is a tough proposition. François Maurin and son Raphael handle the organic vineyards and wine fermented in stainless steel.
title: Château la Croix Blanche 2013  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Brambles and undergrowth aromas give this wine a curious character reflected in the wild strawberry flavors that are not linked to the tannins. This seven-acre Thienpont family property is run by Jan, who has several wine projects, and Florian, who came to wine as a chef.
title: Château La Marotte 2013  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: The aroma is stalky and leathery on the nose. The palate is grabby, with sulfuric, bitter flavors of uncomplicated berry fruits. This is 65% Bobal and 35% Tempranillo.
title: Sierra Norte 2012 Ananto Red (Utiel-Requena)

description: This wine is volatile and grassy on the nose, and extremely horsey. Odd flavors of mango and pineapple are way out of place, and the finish tastes of bad tobacco.
title: Viu Manent 2012 Gran Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

description: This Cava is so heavily oaked that it smells savory and saucy, with almost no fruit to speak of. Woody flavors are barrel-dominated, and so is the monotonous finish.
title: Torre Oria NV Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Scattered, dusty, yeasty aromas of mustard and apple are less than welcoming. This feels choppy and strained, with vanilla and white-fruit flavors.
title: Conde de Subirats NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: This stunning wine is all about extreme elegance and subtlety. It opens with aromas of wild red berry, rose petal, sweet baking spice and a whiff aromatic herb while the focused palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice, pipe tobacco and white pepper. A firm backbone of polished tannins and vibrant acidity gives it an age-worthy structure. It's loaded with finesse and should develop even more complexity over time. Drink 2018–2033.
title: Mascarello Giuseppe e Figlio 2008 Cà d'Morissio Riserva  (Barolo)

description: This young wine is all magnificent structure. It is intense, with fruit and acidity given richness by the powerful texture and tense tannins. The dense symphony of ripe fruits is kept in check by the structure. This wine needs many years; drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Fermented and aged in six-year old wood for 24 months, this is a richly spicy wine. The wood is there to smell and taste, but it is the rich fruit that speaks. Yellow fruits are given weight by the mineral backdrop, while layers of acidity instill freshness. Drink this complex wine from 2018.
designation: Cuvée Authentique Les Clos Grand Cru
title: Domaine Pinson 2012 Cuvée Authentique Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a beautiful wine with elegant fruits that reflect a strong sense of minerality. It is crisp, although that is just a surface quality to a wine that has such depth. Toast flavors round out the intense fruits, giving a light spice and butter to this powerful wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Les Demoiselles  (Chevalier-Montrachet)

description: With its great richness, the wine is opulent, generous and full of powerful fruits. The wood aging and the toastiness have done nothing to diminish the yellow fruit and crisp apple flavors. It's an impressive and concentrated wine that will age for many years. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: A hallmark bottling from one of Serralunga's prime vineyard sites, this gorgeous Barolo has structure, breeding and class. It opens with classic aromas of perfumed berry, leather, forest floor, tobacco and a balsamic note while the impeccable palate delivers wild cherry, crushed raspberry, strawberry, chopped herb, white pepper and licorice. It's still tight and tannic so give it time to fully develop to is full, amazing potential. Drink 2023–2033.
title: Luigi Oddero & Figli 2008 Vigna Rionda  (Barolo)
